A grain, from one evening to the next evening, experiences a shift. After two evenings, the grain has shifted from one location to another.

- Hint: Picture the grain in your head with a time-lapse of one evening after another happening in the background. Slowly, the grain shifts.

Rice that is blue has a strong spirit. Our spirits are blue, so if you ever see rice (or other food, or even people) that's blue, you know that's their spirit radiating out!

- Hint: Picture this rice, the pulsing blue spirit of each grain is glowing so bright!

This building has a pig with horns on it because it's our squad's place.

- Hint: Our symbol is the horn pig and we put it on everything to show the whole world our squad owns this turf. #SQUADGOALS

A canopy is over your car because your car is in storage in a large warehouse.

- Hint: The canopy just protects your car from the elements as it sits in storage for long periods of time.

A woman is one of the few strange things in the world. Everything but a woman can be explained and made sense of. There are only a few strange things in this world, with woman being one of them.

- Hint: Imagine saying this to a woman. Try and imagine her face as you tell her how strange she is.

The gladiator in front of you draws his sword. He points the sword at your chest and right when you think everything is about to end, you realize he's pointing the sword at the ticket in your hand.

- Hint: Right! You needed to buy a ticket to see the gladiator! He doesn't want to kill you, he wants to check to make sure you bought a ticket.

As a hat, four people holding a cross use an umbrella. The umbrella is big enough to be a hat for all four people, so it makes sense. All four of them are religious missionaries, so that’s why they’re holding the cross.

- Hint: See these four people all under one umbrella. No one is carrying the umbrella, it’s just resting on all of their heads like a hat. Their hands are busy holding that cross, anyway.

That woman dressed as Wolverine with a towel tied around her forehead is your wife. You're cosplaying together!

- Hint: Picture your kick-butt wife in her Wolverine costume, the towel around her forehead so she doesn't sweat into her eyes, as you prepare to go to a convention together.

You see a rice paddy and you give it a kiss before granting it the abbreviation, RP. The rice paddy isn’t too fond of this abbreviation, so you kiss it again to soothe it.

- Hint: As you imagine yourself giving a kiss to a rice paddy, think about whether or not the abbreviation RP would ever catch on. Do you think it would?

Grains get blamed for how much they accumulate. If the grains accumulate too much then they make more work for the farmers. If they accumulate too little, then they're starving the people. Ugh, grains just can't win with you people. They're blamed for everything.

- Hint: Picture a pile of grains accumulating in size while a person watches. No matter how large the pile gets, the person keeps blaming them for something!

There’s a tsunami in heaven and you take a small drop of water and append it to the tsunami. Now the tsunami is big enough to destroy all of heaven. The small drop that you appended to the tsunami was just enough to push it over the edge, reaching full destruction capability.

- Hint: Take a small drop of water and append it to the tsunami. Feel the drop of water on your finger and visualize yourself flicking it at the tsunami as it races towards heaven.

Under this roof someone odd is trying to approach you. You back up, but they continue their approach anyway.

- Hint: Imagine being under the same roof as an odd person who wants to approach you. You don't want anything to do with them, but they won't back off.

Under a roof, but still in the sun, a woman is laying out a fabulous banquet. The woman doesn't want anyone to burn from the sun, but banquets are best outside, so she's set up a roof to protect her and her guests.

- Hint: Picture a large banquet of food on a sunny day, covered by an outdoor roof, and a woman carefully setting it all up.

If you're anti-tree, you won't mind if I turn all of them into boards! Hahaha!

- Hint: "Boards are much more useful than trees." - The Anti-Tree Association. Now picture this sign on a big machine that's cutting up all the trees into big boards.

You set up a net on a cross to wash your clothes in the river, when a huge wave of dirt smashes into it, breaking the whole thing and sending your clothes tumbling down the river.

- Hint: Oh, why did it have to break! If the net had been strong enough, your clothes wouldn't be even more dirty and lost down the river right now.

Above you, on a small stool is the eye of your coach. He's really high above you though, and all you can make out is the glint of his eye as he perches on that stool. But he's yelling out orders and corrections, which you can hear very well.

- Hint: Look up from the field or court and see the eye of your coach shining down and watching you closely. It makes you uncomfortable, honestly.

A good leader will use charcoal to mark her colleagues. Sometimes if leaders aren't around all the time, people will get rebellious and act badly toward people who can get them in trouble. So when you mark them with charcoal you know that someone close with your leader is around and you should probably stop being a butt.

- Hint: Imagine seeing one of the leader's colleagues walking around, watching you. You'd get back to work and stop goofing around, right?

column4:
Cup Of Liquid

,

Counter For Cups
column6:
A tree is not a cup of liquid or a counter for cups. Don’t get them mixed up. The last time you tried making a cup out of a tree to count your throat got filled with splinters when you used it. There wasn't even any liquid in it.

- Hint: Imagine cutting a tree into a cup of liquid and focus on the pain in your throat when you try to actually use it. Instead you kick the tree and angrily count cups of liquid in your head, because they simply are NOT the same.

A woman who is good is my daughter. My daughter is a good woman, I guarantee it.

- Hint: Look at how good this woman is! She’s my daughter! She’s good! You wish your daughter was as good a woman as mine is!

They say to wear a hat to cover your hair if your doctor diagnoses you with hair loss. It's the best option, folks.

- Hint: Imagine the doctor diagnosing you with hair loss. He pulls out a hat and places it on your poor, thinning hair.

In the morning, you use a gun on your nose to make it dry.

- Hint: Don't worry, there aren't bullets in the gun. It's an air gun! So just imagine shooting the air into your nose every morning to make sure it's nice and dry.

A district that lacks things will be in Europe.

- Hint: Picture a map of Europe in your mind. Now picture little words saying which district is lacking what. This one is lacking water. That one is lacking food.

A saw cuts into your heart and you are filled with fear. Well, you were filled with fear before the saw reached your heart too, but now that the saw is cutting into your heart, you’re feeling more fear than ever.

- Hint: Try and imagine this saw slicing into your heart. Are you filled with fear? You should be.

An animal eats a child from a plate in a very fierce manner. This is a fierce animal, so it makes sense that it would eat the child in a fierce style.

- Hint: See the fierce animal fiercely eating the child from the plate. It’s very gruesome. See blood and body parts flying everywhere as the animal devours the child.

A tsunami rolls in and destroys all the construction that was being done on the inlet and the bay. Both the inlet and the bay were having a lot of construction done on them to repair the damage from the last tsunami, and then another tsunami rolled in and destroyed all that too. Bummer.

- Hint: Picture all the construction on the bay and the inlet getting destroyed by the tsunami. Look at all of it fall apart and crash to the ground as the tsunami knocks it down. Imagine yourself right near the action, feeling the water spray from the tsunami.

In the morning, Korea will still be Korea.

- Hint: Picture Korea first thing in the morning. You can see all the cities, the countryside, everything waking up.

The narwhal and the turkey are meeting in private to uh, show each other some private things. Doing this they realize they're both male!

- Hint: Picture a male narwhal and a male turkey meeting together in private. Whispering. Giggling. Pointing at each other's male bits.

On every boat there is a table with a lid on it that's used for navigation. When you take the lid off, there is a big map, a sextant, and some little boat miniatures. All the navigation tools.

- Hint: You forget to put the lid back on the navigation station and all those tools and boat pieces go flying around the boat and into the water. Oops.

To the servant you say: "gun, ground, plate." It is your job to oversee everything they do.

- Hint: You point to the gun. You point to the ground (that's where the gun goes). You point to the plate (you want it). You have to oversee everything the servant does.

Under this roof you jackhammer your religion into people.

- Hint: It's a religion building. They have a lot of different names, churches, mosques, temples, cathedrals, but none of those matter. All that matters is that you really drill whichever religion you want into the heads of the people who come under your roof.

If what you say comes out blue, everyone knows that means you made a request. You request a favor and the words slide out of your mouth in a bright, blue blob. They hover in front of you for a few seconds, before splashing onto the person you made the request to.

- Hint: Picture this blue, slimy request. You could have done that thing by yourself, but you requested it of someone else, and now it's all over and everyone can see it.

The soul of a narwhal was sucked into its towel, which is scary!

- Hint: Watch as the narwhal's face contorts as you see its soul get slurped out by the towel it was using.

There is a cross in your forehead with a thread attached to it, forcing you to search where it leads. You’re not sure how the cross got stuck in your forehead, but you are interested in seeing where this piece of thread leads. The search is on.

- Hint: It hurts to have this cross stuck in your forehead, but try to ignore that as you search for where the thread leads. Imagine gathering the thread in your hands as you move along.

The servant radical and the servant kanji are exactly the same! Just remember that the kanji also means retainer and you’ll be fine.

- Hint: Retainer and servant are basically the same thing, so remembering this one shouldn’t be too hard for you.

The leader of the mountain turkeys is our sponsor. He's paying us to say and type everything you're reading.

- Hint: This message is brought to you by our generous sponsor, the leader of the mountain turkeys. Long may he reign.

The dirt you use to go from place to place is the street. Back in the old days, all roads were made of dirt, not like the newfangled roads of today.

- Hint: Imagine using a dirt street to go from one place to another.

Say good luck to one person enough and they'll be stuffed full of that luck.

- Hint: Better safe than sorry. Don't just say good luck once, make sure they're stuffed!

The servant sits on a stool, holding a piece of thread, looking very tense.

- Hint: You walk by this tense servant and pause for a moment. They raise their tense eyes up at you and you can see they're shaking.

column4:
The Cabinet

,

Cabinet
column6:
At the gate, you kiss the cabinet members, one by one. In order to gain access to this government building, you have to kiss all the members of the cabinet at the gate. What a strange ritual.

- Hint: Imagine kissing all the members of the cabinet. A lot of them are old men. Imagine kissing all of them at the gate. Eww.

Your leader sees your bare foot and urges you to put a sock on it.

- Hint: Imagine your leader's face when he sees your bare foot, and just how emphatic he is as he urges you to put a sock on it. He's really worried your foot's going to get cold!

When a yakuza's knife boils, you know something very violent and intense is about to happen.

- Hint: The yakuza member is so upset his knife boils. Right after, they will definitely get violent and intense.

In the ground of the rice paddy is a treasure. You pull it out of the mucky ground. This will renew your life for the better. Again, this treasure will change your life!

- Hint: Pull out the treasure. Think about all the things you will be able to renew in your life. Your car. Your boat. Your house. You lost it all but now you'll be able to get it back.

A demon on a jet is pretty alluring. Demons themselves are pretty intriguing, but put one on a jet? Now that’s alluring.

- Hint: See this demon flying around in his jet. Do you feel allured? You should. Hear the roar of the jet engine as the demon cackles.

You fly north to the moon and break your back when you finally land on it. You weren’t braced for impact so when you hit the moon, your back took all of the impact.

- Hint: Imagine flying north to the moon. Feel the force of being rocketed through space on your journey. Now feel your spine telescope and your back break. It really hurts.

A horse gets trapped in a small room with a stool and an insect, and together they create a very boisterous situation. The horse and the insect are both scrambling frantically to get out of the small room, knocking the stool around all over the place.

- Hint: Imagine the boisterous sounds coming from this small room. Hear the horse neigh and stomp his hooves, hear the insect buzzing loudly, and hear the wooden stool rattle around as the horse and insect try to escape the room.

When you eat you want to see the shape of your gun from under a towel, so you decorate your house with them.

- Hint: Just picture it: an entire home decorated top to bottom with guns covered in towels, so only the outline shows. As your guests try to eat you say, "Guess what gun this is?! Haha, you got it wrong, pull the towel back."

If you want to buy a geoduck you have to go to the bank beforehand to deposit enough money. If you don't deposit your money you won't have enough in your account to buy even one! They're expensive, after all.

- Hint: Imagine yourself depositing your money beforehand. Imagine the delicious geoduck you'll be able to buy now that the money has been deposited into your account!

If you are anti one sided paper you should bind them all up into an edition.

- Hint: One sided paper is just anti everything. It's bad for the environment. It's bad for easy reading. Put all those one sided papers together into one, big edition instead.

You've made yourself a tree bookshelf (that is, a bookshelf cut into a tree), so you build a fence to keep the riffraff out.

- Hint: Your tree bookshelf is often being raided by the neighbors, and since it's outside, all you can do is build a fence around it to protect it. Better check out that fence-building book in your tree bookshelf.

Traveling in the direction of the ocean, you take a gun and shoot a crab, then stick a flag in the beach and claim it as your own. The crab was the only thing standing in the way of you conquering the area. Now that the flag is in the ground, no one can dispute who it belongs to.

- Hint: Look at your flag and hear it flapping in the wind. Also hear your ears ringing a bit from when you shot that crab. Look at all the bits of exploded crab strewn around the area. Yowza.

A tsunami knocks a cleat off a child and the shoe begins to float away in the water. This child was just out playing soccer, minding his own business, when the tsunami crashed in and knocked his cleats off his feet. Now the cleat is floating away with the tsunami.

- Hint: Your cleat is floating away but you’re floating too. The water is really deep now, but you try and float towards your cleat to retrieve it. Imagine floating in this wet water reaching for your lost cleat.

You run every day and soon you become a human that can go beyond the normal speed limits of man. You run and you run and you run. This training allows you to become super human. You go beyond the limits of a normal human. You become a human who can run really fast.

- Hint: Run fast! Go beyond the limits imposed upon you by nature! Imagine yourself running faster than any human has ever run ever. Feel yourself cutting through the air, wind breaking across you as you break the sound barrier. Boom!

The sun is being called on to boil the earth by illuminating it.

- Hint: We don't want the earth to actually boil, but we do want some of that boiling hot sun light to illuminate all of the darkness of the universe and let us see.

A tsunami rips a flag off your house in the rain, causing a leak where it was ripped out. The rain and the tsunami combined just tore the flag right off your house. The force was so strong that it actually removed part of the wall, and now you have a leak in your home.

- Hint: Look at this leak in your house and see the rain water coming in. Hear it drip drip dripping down the wall.

The lineage radical and the lineage kanji are the same.

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

A servant holding a gun sits on the ground to see if he can find something to look at. The servant is on watch duty and has the gun to protect the perimeter. He patrols the grounds to look at the distance to see if there are any trespassers.

- Hint: Look at this servant. He’s doing a great job. Oops, look like he sees you. Yup, he’s pointing his gun at you. Imagine staring down the barrel of his gun as you slowly back away.

You meet a woman from another clan under the rising sun to prepare for marriage. Your clan and her clan are standing together as the two of you watch the sun rise together.

- Hint: Marriage is a big deal and it's going to connect your two clans, so you have to do the ceremony in the sun in front of everyone so they can see.

Your soul will cross through your body and into the net of your clothes so that you'll be hit with nostalgia when you wear them again. Nostalgia for all the things that happened every single time you wore those clothes.

- Hint: When you put on an old piece of clothing, a shirt maybe, or some pants, feel the nostalgia that was embedded in it and left there by your soul.

You put your fingers and an ear on a stool in the sun so you can get your photograph taken. This is a glamour photo, so you have to be in one of these weird, cheesy poses for it to come out jusssst right.

- Hint: Imagine putting your fingers and your ear on a stool, now try to relax your head a little bit, and smile for the camera. This is a professional photograph, so you better do what you're told!

The tree pirate jumps from a tree and attacks you by hitting you with a pillow.

- Hint: It hurts a little bit, but the fact that tree pirates use pillows as their weapons is a bit anticlimactic.

On a scooter running in one direction is a gun-toting child. This is a terribly dangerous situation, but to the child it is just play.

- Hint: Imagine a child riding a scooter with a gun having a good time. "Come play with me!" they shout. "No!" you yell back.

The soul of a person has a hook that can make them pleasant. When you see, hear, or feel something pleasant, can't you feel that hook pressing into the middle of your body?

- Hint: Imagine that feeling you get when everything is just SO pleasant. There is a pressure from your soul's hook digging in. It's a good feeling though, a pleasant one! It isn't too hard or too soft.

Those that can only eat a part of a shellfish are probably a bit poor.

- Hint: Poor people can't even afford a whole shellfish. They have to settle with just a part.

If you do yoga correctly, you will not only prolong your body but your life!

- Hint: Do you want to prolong your life? Then do yoga correctly!

Take your fingers, put them on this turtle shell, and push push push! Push the turtle right on out of there.

- Hint: Picture yourself using your fingers to push a turtle out of its shell. It really doesn't want to leave, so you have to push really hard.

If you look for a leaf among the hills you will notice they are scarce. The hills have no trees around them, so there are no leaves. The leaves are scarce here on the hills.

- Hint: Imagine being on the hills. You want a leaf to find and take back as a souvenir but there are none. Imagine looking feverishly for a leaf even though you don’t really expect to find one.

You're in prison and all you have is a spoon. You use that prison spoon to scoop up nice scents and fragrances out of the air when you have outdoor time and bring them back into your cell.

- Hint: It smells really bad in prison, but your prison spoon is full of all of the lovely scents you remember from when you were free.

The next plate is the one you will steal. This one would be too obvious, better wait for the next one.

- Hint: Wait for this next plate. Here it is—now steal it! Imagine stealing this plate and making off with it.

Picture a shellfish lifeguard. They're not going anywhere. First, they're a shellfish, so they can't really move. And, they're a lifeguard, so they need to be in their lifeguard tower. How does this shellfish lifeguard get stuff? Through subscription services.

- Hint: See a bunch of subscription boxes around the lifeguard tower. It gets everything this way.

A scooter with a mohawk, now that's the most suitable hairstyle you could ever think of for a scooter!

- Hint: You keep seeing scooters all over the city with mohawks and you can't get it out of your head that it's the most suitable thing you've ever seen.

column4:
The Following

,

Following

,

Next
column6:
There are some feathers resting on a stand and you and the following of the feathers are following the feathers. The feathers have a following, and you are one member of the following. You and your fellow followers follow the feathers wherever they may go.

- Hint: Imagine you and the following following the feathers all around. Following the feathers isn’t always easy, but you do it anyway. Imagine touching one of the feathers and feeling the smooth texture on your skin.

You're stuck in a prison on the sun with nothing but a spoon. Lucky for you a tsunami is coming, so you take your spoon and use the tsunami to quench your thirst. You spoon the hot, hot water into your mouth as fast as you can. This is the only way to get water on the sun.

- Hint: Imagine this thirst of yours. You've been in this sun prison for longer than you can remember. You've been holding onto this spoon, waiting for this moment for so long.

You take some bamboo and attach it together into a token of appreciation for your friend. Your friend greatly appreciates this token of friendship.

- Hint: Imagine trying to attach some bamboo together into a token for someone.

If a tsunami hits, it's raining, and you're outside trying to use a rake, you're going to be very wet and damp.

- Hint: Imagine how wet and damp you'd be with tsunami water up to your knees and rain pouring down on your head. You struggle with your rake anyway.

There's a mountain coming out of the ground that you want to climb, but your forehead needs a towel for all your sweat. You don't have a towel, so you take off your belt and tie it around your forehead.

- Hint: The belt is easy to tighten and it catches all the sweat before it can fall into your eyes. It isn't quite as absorbent as a towel though.

The canopy guy is a guy who stands in the corridor trying to sell people canopies.

- Hint: You walk through this corridor every day, and the canopy guy always accosts you with canopy sales. You wish there was another corridor you could take, but it's the only way to get where you want to go.

The rocket turkey has several points which will detach during takeoff.

- Hint: Imagine the rocket turkey taking off. Just like a regular rocket, as it goes up, used pieces of the turkey rocket detach and fall back to the ground.

You loiter around a tombstone to measure its diameter. You’re doing this to each tombstone, and if you loiter around long enough, you’ll soon know the diameter of every tombstone.

- Hint: Imagine loitering around a tombstone. You're leaning on it. You're staring at nothing. Oh, and you're also measuring its diameter.

You see a bully take an insect and dissolve it in some acid. Bullies are messed up, mean people. They do awful things that normal kids and people wouldn't do... like dissolve a living creature.

- Hint: Actually... try to forget this one. Don't think about a bully dissolving things in acid. Think happy thoughts. Like... the bully getting dissolved instead and all the little insects coming back to life and being happy.

You have some dirt next to a pool that has an extra drop of water in it because you need them to be equal. If there's too much dirt outside the pool and not enough water inside, it's gonna look weird. We can't have that.

- Hint: Imagine seeing a pool that isn't equal. It's like a tiny kiddy pool with an inch of water. And it's surrounded by mounds of dirt. No no no, this won't do—add more water to make them equal.

The buildings are at a surplus. Because of that, we will need to exclude some of them from our future plans. Also, we'll need to remove some buildings too.

- Hint: Say you're looking at a map of the city, with all the buildings laid out on it. There are too many, so you start marking which ones to exclude from the building plans. You also remove some buildings from the map all together.

You want to change your shellfish into freight so you can transport it. That means packing them up into giant freight containers.

- Hint: Imagine changing your shellfish from loose, wet form, to solid freight form. It's actually a lot of hard work.

A child shares his lineage with a grandchild. The child passes his lineage down to his child and then that child’s child is the grandchild and between them all a lineage is shared.

- Hint: Look at this family tree. See the child, and then the grandchild. Trace the lineage with your finger as you observe.

There's a strange patch of dirt in this greenhouse that's actually a grave. Dig around a little and you'll find the marker buried in there. If you dig deeper you'll probably find less pleasant things.

- Hint: I guess it makes sense to have a grave in a greenhouse. The heat will help the body decompose, then that nice, rich dirt will help the flowers grow.

column4:
How Many

,

How Much
column6:
You poop twice on a sleeping drunkard person and you find yourself wondering how many more times you can poop on them and wonder how much they can take before they realize what’s going on.

- Hint: You’ve already pooped twice on this drunkard, how many more times can you do it? How much do you think this person can take? Just imagine yourself doing this.

Wolverine is doing a construction job and he’s using his mouth to measure so he knows how many folks he needs to inquire about helping him with the job. Using one’s mouth is a strange way to measure something, but that’s just how Wolverine does things. Once he measures it all out, he’ll know how many construction workers he needs to inquire about working for him.

- Hint: Imagine Wolverine going around, measuring the construction site with his mouth. Look at him with his mouth wide open, wandering around the site deep in thought. What a weirdo.

Bring thread to the library to knit. Libraries are quiet and generally pretty empty nowadays, so it's the perfect place to relax and do some knitting. Of course, if you find thread lying around in a library you know what to do now.

- Hint: Picture yourself sitting on a rocking chair in the library knitting away. It's quiet and peaceful and the light is warming you just right. Ahh, bliss!

A building made from a womb must be placed upon the land.

- Hint: Why must it be placed upon the land? If it were put in water, it would dissolve too quickly. So, you put your womb building on the land, instead.

column4:
Look For

,

Search For
column6:
If you want to get your fingers in the pi tree, you're going to have to look for it. This isn't a tree made of pie, or growing fully-baked pies. It's a pi tree, one that exists infinitely. It's the most rare tree in the world. And if you want to stick your fingers in it, you have to search for it far and wide!

- Hint: Imagine it like a quest from a book or movie. You have a band of travelers, and you're all out searching for it together!

You put a lid on a dish you're cooking, made up of the mouths and foreheads of a pig. Unknown to most, these are the juiciest, most delicious parts of a pig. And dang, they are the most luxurious, too.

- Hint: Mix those pig mouths and foreheads in your pot. Think of how luxurious your soup looks.

You are given some gold to oversee a model. You are a famous architect, so you get a lot of gold for overseeing the construction of models like this one.

- Hint: Feel the gold, heavy in your pockets, as you oversee this model being built. Observe it and watch as it grows under your watchful eye.

A tsunami came in and buried your flag so now you have to use a spoon and dig it out of the mud.

- Hint: Imagine using a spoon to dig your flag outta all this mud. So much mud! Feel its cold, soiled wetness on your hands as you dig away.

Birds use grass and fruit to make their nests.

- Hint: Picture a cute little nest with a family of birds in it. It looks like it was woven together with bits of grass and strawberries, so it smells delicious too.

You line up your body with the sun and everything looks normal. The sun is lined up behind you, and you’re looking at all the things the sun has lit up. Everything looks normal.

- Hint: Gaze out in a line from the sun as you observe the world. Everything is very normal looking and comforting.

column4:
Pole

,

Rod

,

Wooden Pole
column6:
A tree in spring that's nice and dry will make a good pole or rod. Break it out of the ground and it's just flexible enough for tons of applications.

- Hint: Use this pole to hang your towels or curtains. Ooh, use it to pole vault!

If you grind rice, every part of it, eventually it will become a fine powder. You can then use this rice powder as a part to create some other dish. Some kind of cake, perhaps.

- Hint: Imagine yourself grinding this rice into a powder. Hear the scrape of the rice on stone as you grind it down to the finest powder.

There's a root where your fang previously was. Your fang isn't there anymore, you ripped it out.

- Hint: Look at the root where your fang previously was. Previously, when you were young, you had a lot of nice fangs but they're all rotting as you get older and you pull them out.

You request that winter rescue you from the warmth of the other seasons.

- Hint: It's so hot. You hate it. You really hope winter will get your request and come early to rescue you.

A leader of (odd looking) lions puts a drop of magic liquid on his face to look like a person who might resemble someone else. The leader of lions is going incognito, so he needs to resemble a person who is not himself. He takes this drop of powerful face paint and transforms.

- Hint: Watch this leader as the transformation takes place. Now he doesn’t resemble anything like the leader he used to be. He doesn’t look like the same person. Watch him morph in your head.

On your roof is a scarecrow because you're rich. You want to scare away all the poor, non-rich people so you put a scarecrow on your roof.

- Hint: Imagine looking up at the roof at this scarecrow. There's a sign around its neck that says, "Rich people welcome." Ah, you're safe. Time to go to bed!

If you play blackjack on the moon in the winter, your cards will scatter everywhere. The cards scatter because the gravity is so weak on the moon, so the blackjack game is prone to disaster.

- Hint: Imagine playing blackjack on the moon where even the slightest move causes the cards to scatter about. Watch them float along. It’s very frustrating to play this way.

column4:
Showy

,

Flower

,

Gorgeous
column6:
Flowers growing out of a rice paddy into the shape of a cross are really showy flowers.

- Hint: Picture these showy flowers growing straight up and out of the middle of the rice paddy, into the shape of a giant cross.

You use your mouth when you see a Chinese person and you sigh. You sigh so loud that it’s practically a roar coming out of your mouth. Chinese people and Chinese things make you sigh because it reminds you of when you stayed in China and it brings up memories. The sigh is a sigh of nostalgia.

- Hint: Let out a long sigh as you recall memories from China and all the Chinese things you saw and did. Oh, sigh.

Your leader sticks his toe into a shellfish. You ask him why and he says he wants to spy on it.

- Hint: There’s a hidden camera on his toe and the leader wants to have plenty of secret spy footage to review later.

If you can write an interesting poem about winter while riding on a horse, I’ll be pretty surprised. It’s hard enough to write a poem as it is, let alone an interesting one. And then you’re riding on a horse and the poem has to be about winter? Heck, I’d be surprised if you didn’t fall off the horse and injure yourself.

- Hint: Imagine trying to write a poem while riding a horse. It’d be really hard to do. I bet you’d be surprised if you managed to do it as well.

Wolverine ties a towel around his forehead and takes out his fingers instead of his claws so he can sweep the floor clean. When Wolverine fights, his claws are out and he makes a big ol' mess. But once the fighting is done, it's time to get to work and sweep the mess up.

- Hint: Picture Wolverine, hair held back with a towel, claws retracted, sweeping up a bar that he just had a big fight in. He's sweeping up broken bottles and broken chairs and broken evil x-men.

You want some flowers so you take your cleat to the side of a tree hoping they'll fall down, but you get a vegetable instead. What? You kick the tree again and another, different vegetable falls out.

- Hint: Now you have two vegetables and no flowers. Do vegetables even grow on trees?

Under the moon while you sit on a cliff, you inject a syringe of tofu right into your vein. Ahh, tofu. You’re addicted to it. You sneak out to the cliff at night to get your tofu fix, injecting it straight into your vein.

- Hint: Feel the tofu running through your veins. Feel the tofu goodness spreading all over your body. It’s so intense you can even taste a little tofu in your mouth.

You're loitering, staring down at the cross that got caught in the net of your heart, because it's trying to teach you to act with virtue.

- Hint: People who keep the cross in their hearts are supposed to be full of virtue, always doing the right thing, always helping others. But you aren't sure if you want to be virtuous, it's a lot of responsibility. So you look down at this symbolic cross and loiter instead of making a decision.

The warehouse radical and the warehouse kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

Mix spiders into alcohol to make acid. Spiders have a little bit in them already, but if you really want to make it potent, smash them in some whiskey to make a deadly acid that will rip through anything.

- Hint: Imagine crushing up some spiders into alcohol. Watch it turn green. It's going to eat through the beaker! Quick, do something!

A husband and his husband find a shellfish and agree to share it.

- Hint: Picture the husbands pulling a different side of the shellfish, it pops in two, and they each get a shell. They smile and high five.

You come across a spirit wearing a top hat and it claims to be your ancestor. Well of course, if you remember correctly, all of your ancestors wore top hats when they were alive. This spirit must be your long lost, great great... uh... somebody.

- Hint: Imagine coming across your long dead top hatted ancestor in spirit form. What would you do? What would you say?

A gold bar can be turned into a coin. Well, more than one coin, probably. But you know for sure that you can make at least one coin out of this gold bar.

- Hint: Imagine taking this gold bar and punching a coin out of it. Imagine yourself pulling a lever to press a coin out of the gold bar. Feel the lever going down as you hear the sound of a gold coin being punched out.

A scooter sits at the entrance where people enter. You jump on and are flung inside! Because a lot of other people did the same thing, it's really crowded in here.

- Hint: Imagine going to your favorite store. There's a scooter on and waiting at the entrance. You can't see inside, so when you are scooted inside by the scooter, you just get thrown into a packed room. So many other people on scooters! It's too crowded!

If you want to go to Korea you'll need a good defense.

- Hint: Things in Korea haven't been on the safest side lately, so make sure you have some ways to defend yourself before you go.

A tree combines with a table to make a desk. When you think about it, a desk is just a table with more stuff. To make this more stuff, like drawers and such, you need more wood, and wood comes from trees. Add materials from the tree to the table and you have a desk.

- Hint: Chop this tree into pieces to transform this table into a desk. Hear the sounds of construction in your head as you make this desk with your bare hands.

A tsunami hits the ground, dumping all the muddy water onto this poor beggar, making him very dirty.

- Hint: Picture the dirty beggar gasping for air on the dirty ground. He was not expecting to get hit by a tsunami today.

You eat part of a director to domesticate him. This director has been going around kicking cameramen and punching actors and it’s really ruining his reputation. You need to domesticate him. The only way to do this is to shock him into submission. His ego is so big from two blockbusters that you have to eat part of him to get him to calm down.

- Hint: Which part of the director did you choose to eat in order to domesticate him? Think about eating that part of the director and imagine its taste in your mouth as you chew. Eww.

Put a spirit in a black hole and a duplicate comes out. The duplicate looks exactly like the original spirit that went in. How strange.

- Hint: Examine the duplicate spirit. Same ghosty body. Same ghosty glow. A perfect copy.

A tsunami runs into nine trees and produces a dye the color of the forest. The tsunami water mixes with each tree, nine of them actually, and the resulting liquid is a forest green dye.

- Hint: Imagine this happening in front of you. See the tsunami turn from the color of water to the color of a forest. The dye washes over you and now you’re forest green as well.

Two pools, both altered and not quite like a pool you’ve seen before are put together and flipped around – this is an egg. One pool is the egg white, the other pool is the egg yolk. They’re different, but similar.

- Hint: Separate the two pools from one another. Now the pools look like the kanji. The kanji is one white pool and one yellow pool. Neat, huh?

The eternity radical and the eternity kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

Taking a piece of thread you blame the exploits of your past on poor judgment. You tie this thread around your finger to remind you of all the exploits you accomplished in your day. Most of them weren’t actually on purpose, so you blame them on poor judgment and accident.

- Hint: Think up what exploits you accomplished. What sort of things might you have done, but not quite on purpose? Think about how it feels to be exalted for such exploits that were but mere accidents.

The eye's root is the eyeball.

- Hint: Go ahead and feel your eyeballs moving around in your head. Your eyes aren't just the part on the surface, they're the whole balls in there, attached at the root.

A tsunami that hits at night leaves even more fluid than normal. It's dark at night, so the sun isn't there to help evaporate all that tsunami liquid.

- Hint: Picture the dark fluids from the tsunami flowing by your window at night. You look out and the liquid is shining in the moonlight. It looks like an entire sea is out there!

Take your fingers and dig the tree bits out of this cleat to gather it into evidence. Gather it in a pile or a bag, just make sure it's all in one place so you can take a closer look later.

- Hint: Picture your fingers really getting in there to gather the tree pieces from out of this cleat. Some of the tree bits are stabbing under your fingernails, but you have to keep gathering them, don't stop now!

If you can understand a samurai's heart, you'll discover their true intentions.

- Hint: If you're facing down a samurai, it's pretty important for you to be able to understand their intentions. Not all samurai are good, you know.

There’s a comb and what looks like the same comb, and you found them on the ground next to some fins you showed interest in. At first, the shiny fins on the ground caught your interest, but once you got closer to the fins you also noticed a pair of combs that are interesting too.

- Hint: Pick up these fins and the two combs. Feel their weight in each hand as you examine them with interest. Smell the fish smell and feel the teeth on the combs.

If you have a big mouth but a good heart, people will recognize your kindness. Even if you blabber on with your big mouth, as long as everyone knows that your heart is filled with kindness, they will love and accept you.

- Hint: Share your kindness with the world. Use your big mouth to let people know what you’re doing. “I’M TAKING OUT THE TRASH AND NOBODY EVEN ASKED ME!” Y’know, that sort of thing. Go ahead and say that out loud a few times.

If you use a slide to enter a building, you'll be sliding for a long time.

- Hint: Imagine a never-ending slide that goes deep down inside a building. You can't see anything in the dark around you, you just plunge down and slide forever. And forever is a long time, my friend.

A Viking and his older brother join a party. They can raid and pillage better in a group like this, so it makes sense that the Viking and his older brother would join a group with other Vikings.

- Hint: Look at this big group that contains the Viking and his older brother. Hear them shouting as a group and imagine their Viking battle cry.

If the canopy comes beforehand, it's a preface for the rest of the canopy.

- Hint: Although not necessarily a book preface, you can imagine a book made out of canvas pages. The canvas pages that came beforehand (i.e. in the beginning, before the book started) is the preface.

You count nine of them in the tree, each turkey holding something random or miscellaneous. There are nine turkeys in the tree and they’re all holding random, miscellaneous things. How odd.

- Hint: Look at the turkeys in the tree. There are nine of them and they are all gobbling up a storm. Hear them gobble as you imagine what random, miscellaneous things they are holding.

column4:
Sakura

,

Cherry Tree

,

Cherry Blossom
column6:
Under a tree sitting on the grass is a woman who loves sakura, or cherry tree, if you’re an English speaker. This woman really likes to just chill out in the grass under these cherry trees and watch the sakura blossoms. It’s very pretty.

- Hint: Imagine yourself sitting under the tree in the grass with the woman. Smell the cherries and see the sakura blossoms falling down all around you. How whimsical.

The roof of a certain mountain shrouds its contents in secrecy.

- Hint: I can't even tell you which mountain it is, nor how to get in. That's what secrecy is all about.

A grain is certain to keep a secret.

- Hint: Imagine telling a piece of grain your deepest, darkest secret.

If you see a grassy cliff with an elf under it in winter, it's because their parents are so strict. When elf kids misbehave they're supposed to go stand under grassy cliffs to think about what they've done.

- Hint: Only really, really strict parents would make their kids do that in the middle of winter! It's cold!

When you're at your cottage the only thing you do with your fingers is throw away things. The cottage is for vacation. And vacation means being as lazy as possible. But you certainly don't want to live in filth, so you have to throw away your trash at least.

- Hint: Imagine sitting in your cottage. You throw away a banana peel. You throw away some used suntan lotion. You throw away all your cares in the world.

They say a shrimp who is bad with translation has no reason to live. Most shrimp make a living with their translation skills. They are the translators of the ocean. If they don’t know how to say something in all the languages of the sea, they have no reason to live. They might as well be dead.

- Hint: Imagine this one shrimp who is bad at translation. He’s trying to find a reason to live, but he’s having trouble. Look at him all alone, being shunned by the other shrimp.

In the valley you feel a lack of want. You want for nothing in this valley. It is the valley of plenty.

- Hint: Think of how much you want to be in this valley. They have everything in there. You lack nothing. You want for nothing. Man, you wanna be in that valley so badly.

You're in the sun playing football and you get very warm.

- Hint: Feel how warm the sun is, as you try to throw and catch the football.

In its scooter, a cat pirate scoots up to welcome you!

- Hint: "Nya! Welcome to my ship, grab a scooter and scoot on up here, we're about to start the welcome ceremonya!"

If a leader has a gun it's easy to wound people. When you have a gun and a lot of responsibility it's easy to get carried away and mess up, wounding the people you were supposed to be protecting. You can even wound yourself.

- Hint: Picture how easy it would be for the leader of your country to wound someone if they had a gun. Scary, right?

On a cliff, a fire burns to ashes. The ashes then blow off the cliff, and follow the wind wherever it may go.

- Hint: See the light from the fire as the ashes fly off the cliff. The wind carries some of the ashes over to you. Feel the ashes as they strike your face and wipe the black ash with your hands.

If you see icicles hanging off of a samurai's clothes, don't worry, those are just part of his winter attire. Samurai have to travel and fight in all sorts of conditions, so it only makes sense that they have attire for every season.

- Hint: Picture a samurai in his winter attire. His helmet is white and fuzzy and he has decorative icicles hanging down off of his armor.

If someone is holding flowers, they're probably an author. Authors really love flowers, because they help them think of flowery language they can use to sound smart in their books.

- Hint: Imagine a time when a book you were reading used flowery language and you couldn't understand. Imagine the annoyance with the author for using words that are hard to understand.

column4:
Backside

,

Underside

,

Reverse
column6:
There's a lid on your village, so you kick it over on its backside to see what's on its underside.

- Hint: You've been curious about what's on the lid (and your village's) backside for years, and you finally can't take it anymore so you kick the lid as hard as you can!

column4:
Closed

,

Close

,

Closure
column6:
The gate to the genius is now closed. The genius’ visiting hours are over, so the gate is closed. This genius has been genetically modified to know more than any human could know, and his days are spent answering questions and advising. But now, his work day is over, so his gates are closed.

- Hint: See the genius sitting behind the gate as it creaks closed in front of you. Hear the gate slam closed as you keep in mind that this genius has been modified to have increased intelligence because the genius radical in this kanji is modified as well.

column4:
Crotch

,

Groin

,

Fork
column6:
You keep your moon weapon in your crotch. Where else would you keep it?

- Hint: Your moon weapon is a moon that you keep in your crotch. We'll let you imagine how this one works...

This car is all weird because it looks like the side is going to dangle and drip off or something. The front bumper of the car is dangling off and the sides of the car look like they could drip off at any moment.

- Hint: Compare this kanji to the car kanji, 車. See how the sides and top are different? Use that to remember that this car looks like it’s falling apart. See the parts dangle, and hear the drip of car fluids falling out. This car is a wreck.

A tsunami hits the greenhouse, destroying the last remaining plant life in the area. The tsunami recedes, and there is nothing but sand, and the lands become a desert.

- Hint: The greenhouse was your only hope in turning the desert into a green forest. Now it's all washed away by salt water, meaning nothing will grow anyways. Feel disappointed about this.

Put a rice paddy together with other paddies and you'll see how much they differ. When you're driving or taking a train through the countryside it may seem like all of those rice paddies blurring together are all the same, but they can differ quite a bit!

- Hint: Try to picture how each rice paddy differs from the next. Can you think of any differences in the ones you've seen?

Social commentary aside, the white king is the king that wears all white. Traditionally, this is someone better than a king. The emperor!

- Hint: See the emperor, garbed all in white. There are other kings, but the emperor's white clothing shows his status above the rest.

To make your fingers wide you extend them.

- Hint: Extend your fingers right now and see how wide you can make them.

A greenhouse is already really good when it comes to a plant's livelihood. But add the sun into that equation and you have something really great for the plants. Their livelihood will be awesome, now!

- Hint: Just feel happy that your plants have such a nice livelihood now that the sun is out. They look so healthy and fresh!

Those that are in the middle of your heart are the ones you have the most loyalty towards. The middle of your heart is the most sacred, special place for people, so it makes sense that those you keep in the middle of your heart are those you are most loyal to.

- Hint: Who do you feel the most loyalty towards? Imagine them in the middle of your heart. Feel them in your chest. Imagine them, literally inside the middle of your heart.

There is a moon and a city inside your lung. Inside of your lung there is a city and above that city lies a moon. It’s a pretty sight, but also very strange. Moons and cities don’t usually reside inside lungs.

- Hint: Imagine having a moon and a city inside your lung. Feel their presence as you breathe in and breathe out. Also, 月 often refers to internal organs as well, so remember that when you see this kanji.

To say what's in a samurai's heart you start a magazine. You go around writing about and interviewing all the samurai so you can share what they say to everyone who wants to read!

- Hint: Why hadn't anyone thought of making a samurai magazine before?!

If someone has their fingers in your syrup, it's just another way of saying they manipulated you. Cause only slimy people manipulate other people, so their fingers are slimy and sticky because they're covered in your syrup from mucking up your life.

This also has another meaning: chastity. Just imagine if someone wanted you to keep your chastity and they called s.e.x. when someone "puts their fingers in your syrup." That would be pretty effective, right? Cause it's like, super gross.

- Hint: "Ah golly gee wiz, he sure got his fingers all up in my syrup again, dagnabbit." You know, this saying we say all the time when someone manipulates us into doing something.

This bamboo absorbed the moon's power, and you want that power in your body, so you surgically insert them into your body to replace your muscles and tendons.

- Hint: Picture your new bamboo muscles glowing under your skin with the moon's power. You flex and feel the power coursing through you!

The Not Mouth says “no”. What else would you expect from something named the “Not Mouth”? The Not Mouth will always say “no”, regardless of the question.

- Hint: Imagine encountering this Not Mouth. Ask it a question. It answers, “No”. Imagine doing this over and over until you believe that the Not Mouth always says “no”.

column4:
Pile

,

Prosperous

,

Heap
column6:
If you become a plate, I will pile food up upon you. With such a huge pile, everyone will think you're prosperous.

- Hint: If you have piles of something, you're prosperous. If you become a plate, that's the best thing that can happen to you.

Someone climbs onto the roof from the ground when dawn comes to proclaim that a new day has begun! They proclaim this at the top of their lungs!

- Hint: Picture a shadowy shape on top of the roof, proclaiming to the entire town that the new day is here! It's come! And it's also time to get up.

The leader who is king of every shellfish sets the rent for everyone. If you rent a home in King Shellfish's kingdom, the rent will be set by the great shellfish leader himself.

- Hint: King Shellfish loves when people rent from him. Imagine him rolling in all of the rent money (shellfish) he collected from all the people who rent from him. Hear his shell clattering as he frolics on all the dead shells from the shellfish.

Writing a poem about winter is the only way to get respect from other poets.

- Hint: Even better, write a poem about winter IN winter. Then they'll really respect you.

The horns of the creatures who drink alcohol have a measurement so large that they are revered the world over. The horns are revered both for their size and potency. The horns can be used in medicine, so they are very valuable, those alcoholic monster horns.

- Hint: Look at one of these revered horns. Pick it up and feel its weight. It measures very large. Your arms are getting tired from the weight.

You lay your sock in a little circle and boil it so it will ripen.

- Hint: You don't want to clean the sock, you want all of those nasty foot and shoe juices to ripen into the sock. It's like how the longer you let an apple ripen, the worse it smells and tastes, after a while.

Your mouth has some hidden horns, and if you have the right alcohol measurement in your body, those horns will come out of your mouth in the form of rumors and gossip.

- Hint: It's really easy for you to let a rumor slip if you've had a certain amount of alcohol. And those rumors have horns, they're dangerous.

If you grind a stone down to more than just a few pieces, it will become sand. Stones that get broken up enough will become sand, and you pick up a few grains in your hand.

- Hint: Feel these few grains of sand between your fingertips. Imagine the stones that they originally came from. Nature is crazy.

Keeping at a bamboo interval is the definition of simplicity.

- Hint: Just one bamboo wide, over and over. That is simplicity.

If you take the flowers off some coral and boil them, steam comes out.

- Hint: Steam comes out of the coral flowers because they hold a lot of water. They're flowers, but they're coral flowers, so they came from the ocean. Of course there's water in them, and if you boil that water steam will come out.

The storehouse radical and the storehouse kanji meanings are the same. If you know the radical, you know the kanji!

- Hint: Your brain is like a storehouse, you know? Hopefully that's where you kept your storehouse knowledge.

Bring rice under a canopy, crush it with your brush, and sweep the white powder in your mouth... it's sugar now! You make sugar by carefully crushing rice to a powder, until it's small enough to brush into your mouth.

- Hint: Taste the sugar in your mouth and feel the breeze waft under the canopy. You're surrounded by rice, but what's in your mouth is definitely sugar now.

The thread you have inside is your whole supply. When you're outside sewing and you run out, you just go inside, look through your supply, and pick a new one.

- Hint: Go inside your house or shed, it doesn't matter where, and look happily at your thread supply. You have thread in all sizes, shapes, and especially colors.

They say someone with various talents is important. Various talents can include speaking various languages so if you are someone who knows various languages you can say things that various peoples will comprehend.

- Hint: You are someone who can say things in various languages. Speak some of these various languages now. You are someone who is good at saying things. Nice job.

The hole leading to the private heart of your house is the window. Or maybe it's just the window to your soul, and not your house. Like the poetry people say.

- Hint: Imagine someone looking into a hole that shows your private heart. That's a window. A window you probably should have kept closed. Now everyone is looking in.

The beans radical and the beans kanji are exactly the same!

- Hint: *toots*

A tree branch is exactly what it sounds like: the branch of a tree.

- Hint: Picture a tree branch in your hands. Feel it. Smell it. It smells and feels like a tree.

You stand on the forehead of your car, take your fingers and brandish them in the air! You wave them around for everyone to see.

- Hint: Imagine standing on top of your car, brandishing your fingers in the air, all of the cars stuck behind yours honking angrily.

A slice with a knife is called a carve.

- Hint: You carve meat, you carve wood, all with a slicing motion with a knife.
The <radical>claw</radical> radical and the <kanji>claw</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Ravishing!

A child will ask if they want two waters because they need a grown-up's consent. Children aren't allowed to have whatever they want, they need to make sure it's okay and get consent first.

- Hint: Picture the child finishing their first water. They look at a big stack of bottled waters, but they know better than to just take two more, they need consent first. "Excuse me, sir, could I please have two more waters?" the child asks.

Your mouth was sliced open by a terrible cough.

- Hint: You've heard of a hacking cough, right? Well, this is worse. It's a slicing cough, and it's sliced right through your mouth, too. Imagine it flapping around while you cough.

Hang a towel in a greenhouse and it turns into a curtain. Greenhouses are made of windows, it's all glass, there are no walls. So when you put a towel in there it turns into a curtain. It has no choice but to cover a window, after all.

- Hint: Imagine hanging towels over all the windows in the greenhouse. They're really fuzzy, thick curtains now.

column4:
Deep Red

,

Crimson
column6:
In this construction project, they will be using thread to hold everything together. The color of the thread is a deep red, and it gives everything a crimson look.

- Hint: Because thread isn't that strong, you have to use A LOT (to hold things like beams in place). So, the deep red / crimson thread actually stands out a lot in this construction project.

An arrow is what this turkey lacks. For a turkey, that is a delight.

- Hint: A turkey that lacks an arrow is a delighted turkey.

Inside the building is the Winter Cow. You need to see it, so you go inside. It is deep down in there, and you'll have to descend to reach it.

- Hint: Focus on descending the stairs. There are many signs that say "To Winter Cow: descend" with an arrow pointing down. "I guess I'll have to descend," you say.

The woman sitting on that stool is actually a dude. Oh oops! You thought he was a woman because of his long hair and the way he was sitting. Maybe you shouldn't be judging people based on their looks!

- Hint: Dude, I can't believe you called that dude a woman. What's wrong with you?!

The ear and the mouth of a king are holy. The king has holy hearing and holy eating abilities. This king is divine.

- Hint: See the holy ear and mouth of this king. They glisten and glitter and people write hymnals about their holy prowess. Imagine a song playing as you witness their holy majesty.

If a turkey is pointing its fingers at you, you can infer that it wants revenge. This turkey knows you killed his brother for dinner last night, and now he’s going to make you pay. You infer that this turkey is going to take their fingers and wrap them around your neck.

- Hint: Imagine a turkey is pointing at you with its fingers. The gears in your brain begin to slowly turn. From looking at the turkey to its fingers and back to the turkey, you can infer that something bad is probably about to happen to you.

Your moon storehouse is another storehouse you own. Remember how your regular storehouse holds zombies (from the kanji 蔵?). Your moon storehouse is on the moon, and it is filled with internal organs.

- Hint: Your moon storehouse has internal organs because 1) you have to keep them far away from the zombies or they'll go berserk, and 2) you think it's funny to see them bounce around in low gravity. Boing, boing, boing, haha look at that internal organ.

Raise your fingers to another member and you'll receive a loss in return. You should never hurt a member of your team, group, or society. It's just wrong. And you'll incur a loss as punishment for your bad deeds.

- Hint: Imagine raising your fingers to slap, hurt, or point angrily at a member of your own team. How dare you! I hope you're ready for some deep, personal loss.

Seeing a stone and some horns on the ground next to a piece of poop and another piece of poop, you try and pick each of them up with a magnet. The magnet fails to pick up either piece of poop. The magnet doesn’t pick up the horns either. But wait! The magnet picks up the stone!

- Hint: Imagine yourself trying to pick each object up off the ground with your magnet. Hear the clink of the stone against metal as the magnet lifts it off the ground. Must be some iron in it or something.

They say accidentally firing a catapult is an unforgivable mistake. They say you shot the catapult at your own castle. Even though it was an accident, it’s still a mistake you will never be forgiven for.

- Hint: Imagine shooting the catapult on your own people by mistake. Hear the catapult whoosh as your heart drops into your stomach. Oh, what a terrible mistake you’ve just made.

The original tsunami was the origin of Japan. A big tsunami came and uncovered the islands of Japan. It's the origin of all life, as far as Japanese people are concerned.

- Hint: Picture the original tsunami used in the origin story of Japan. It was huge. Bigger than anything you've ever seen. And without it you wouldn't have your precious anime and mangos.

If you see some dry flowers, pull them up and you'll find a potato.

- Hint: Potatoes grow when flowers dry out. All the nutrients are going to the potato under the ground, so the flowers up top get sucked dry.

Make your barracks out of thread so it will be pure. If you build it out of clay or bricks or wood, it will inevitably have some dirt in it. Build it out of thread to keep it pure of... well, impurities.

- Hint: Imagine a barracks pure white, like pure snow, made of pure thread.

You want some flowers to put on the canopy above your helicopter to keep the birds away, so you ask people what they would recommend.

- Hint: You've bought flowers before, but you really don't know which ones would work best to stop birds from landing on the canopy and pooping on your helicopter.

Into a well, a drop of rice falls from your rice bowl. You were eating out of your rice bowl on the side of a well, and some rice fell out of your rice bowl and this drop of rice proceeded to fall all the way down.

- Hint: You lost a drop of rice from your rice bowl. Feel sorrow for the lost rice as you watch it fall down the well and hear it splat into the water below.

Attach meat to your canopy and it will rot.

- Hint: Imagine the smell of rotten meat hanging from your canopy. Now no one wants to come near here.

There's a tsunami coming, so you put your fins on, open your mouth wide, and try to run alongside it.

- Hint: Your mouth is open so you can scream, because this is probably a bad idea.

You need to take a body measurement before you can shoot. Whether it's for a photo shoot, you're gonna shoot them with a gun, or if you're about to shoot them full of radiation for X-rays, you need the right measurements of that body first.

- Hint: Imagine someone measuring your body before they shoot you. You hope it's the good kind of shoot and that you're not going to die.

A magic thread fell from the roof onto the leader of a hundred people, causing him to shrink!

- Hint: Picture one hundred people under the same roof watching in horror as their leader suddenly shrinks to nothingness before them.

The samurai has a jackhammer, a brush, and some water. All these things tell you that this samurai is actually a slave.

- Hint: Traditionally, samurai don't carry things like jackhammers, brushes, or water. The samurai is carrying these things for someone else, meaning this samurai is somebody's slave.

There’s some rice in the shape of a nine on a cross and this is stylish. The rice grains are arranged to form the number nine. This number nine is prominently displayed on the cross, and it’s stylish to carry it around and be seen with it.

- Hint: Imagine hefting this cross with the rice in the shape of a nine on it. You don’t feel stylish, but society tells you that you are. You’re stylish.

You are so sick that you've come to look like the humble stool: thin. Eerily thin, in fact.

- Hint: Imagine standing behind a stool and being able to disappear behind it completely. That's how thin this sickness has made you.

column4:
Throw Up

,

Spit

,

Vomit
column6:
If you put dirt in your mouth you're going to throw up. That's just a fact.

- Hint: That's pretty much what throwing up feels like too, right? Like a bunch of dirt coming out of your mouth. Barf.

In the middle of the ground is a shellfish that is very valuable. Inside of this valuable shellfish is a priceless treasure, and it’s just lying there in the middle of the ground.

- Hint: Look at this valuable shellfish. What could be inside? Pick it up and shake it about, trying to guess what valuable thing is enclosed.

You see a thread that wants to loiter from some horns and you would be correct to assume that it would hang vertical. The thread wants to loiter and hang from one of the horns. When things hang from things, they usually hang vertical, so that’s what this thread is going to do.

- Hint: Look at this vertical thread as it hangs from the horns. Take hold of it and pull on the vertical thread. Feel it in your hand.

Boots give you the power to work! That's why so many professions require you to have work boots.

- Hint: Imagine putting your boots on and suddenly being filled with the power and energy to work hard and efficiently.

Take your fingers and dry them. Then dry them again. This is what you do when you are in worship. Once you go into your place of worship, and again before you leave. You have really sweaty fingers, and you can't worship anyone or anything if you have wet hands. So you dry them!

- Hint: Picture your sweaty, sweaty fingers. Dry them off before you enter a place of worship! No god wants to deal with your weird, damp hands.

The ability to boil is one of the main abilities of a bear.

- Hint: I bet you didn't know this, but a bear can boil whenever it wants. Imagine a bear heating itself up and boiling, its fur and skin bubbling and letting off steam.

Your mouth is wearing a mask so people won't realize you're the one being so boisterous. You want to be loud and rowdy, but you don't want anyone to know it's you. If you cover your mouth with this mask, people won't know you're the one being so boisterous.

- Hint: Go put a mask on right now, cover everything around your mouth so it's hard to tell who you are. Now go outside and be as boisterous as possible!

There is a circumference around someone's hair, as in, you can see a circle drawn around the top of their head. As you examine it closer, and pull at it a bit, you realize that someone has carved the hair off someone's head!

- Hint: Their hair has literally been carved out of their head, and you discovered it. Of course, the nastiness, the smell, and the feel should be applied to your imagination to make the mnemonic stronger.

There’s a tree in your hair, I think it’s a cedar. How did that cedar tree get in your hair?

(Certain types of cedar trees have bark that comes off in fine threads, making them very hairy trees. So this kanji makes perfect sense!)

- Hint: Imagine having a cedar tree in your hair. It’s just a little tree, a sapling, but it’s pretty strange and awkward. It does smell nice though. Mmm… cedar.

The mouth of the World Tree, all it does is chat and talk.

- Hint: You'd think the World Tree's mouth would talk wisdom, but all it does is chat, chat, chat.

Gold is not the same as copper. They are two different metals. Gold is not the same as copper.

- Hint: Take a piece of gold in one hand and a piece of copper in the other. Bang them together furiously as you shout. “GOLD IS NOT THE SAME AS COPPER! GOLD IS NOT THE SAME AS COPPER!”

The kanji and the radical that look like this are exactly the same. They are both cottage.

- Hint: As long as you know the radical cottage, you know the kanji cottage.

You have an alcohol nine times stronger than any other drink in a bottle shaped like a cross and you drink it all and become drunk. You’re like, so drunk right now from all that alcohol. Nine times more drunk than ever before.

- Hint: Feel how drunk you are as you look at the cross shaped bottle that once held the alcohol. See the cross start to blur in front of you from how drunk you are.

Fire, fire, flame! There’s flames everywhere!

- Hint: Feel the fire all around you, the flames licking at your body. It’s really hot!

If you loiter around my skin, he will get angry at you. He is my boyfriend and he is very protective of me. So don’t loiter around my skin for too long or he will beat you up.

- Hint: He is a jealous guy. He will beat you down if you loiter around my skin for too long. Imagine he is beating you up right now. He is screaming at you as he does so.

You create a thread with someone by calling out to them to introduce yourself.

- Hint: You literally call out, and when they turn around, tie a thread to them, so you'll never forget that you introduced yourselves to each other.

The jammed in radical and the jammed in kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

The tsunamis during the old moons (many moons ago) were responsible for the world's lakes.

- Hint: Where did lakes come from? They are the residue of tsunamis from many moons ago.

Try to say something to a lifeguard and you'll just end up getting a lecture.

- Hint: A lifeguard's favorite part of the job is telling people what to do, where to swim, when to get out of the water, and they love saying it in a bunch of words.

In spring, your measurements will reveal your lifespan. Only in spring can you measure your lifespan, just as easily as you measure your height and weight.

- Hint: On the first day of spring, all the girls and boys line up to measure their lifespans.

A tsunami will pick up a bunch of shellfish and dump them on your shore, so you take a knife and measure them.

- Hint: You can't eat shellfish that are too small, so you place your knife along them to measure them. If they're big enough, you stick the knife in and eat them raw.

The ground and a shuriken have mutual respect for one another. The shuriken respects the ground because of how solid and stable it is, and the ground respects the shuriken for how pointy it is. They have great mutual respect here.

- Hint: Pick up the shuriken and throw it into the ground. Hear it whizz through the air and then plunk into the ground. This act of aggression causes their mutual respect to waver.

This tsunami is the reason we have so much oil now. The tsunami moved a bunch of earth out of the way, so now it’s really easy to dig for oil. Thanks tsunami!

- Hint: Watch as this tsunami crashes over the land, pushing earth out of the way. Once the tsunami passes, hear the spewing geysers of oil as they erupt out of the ground.

The kanji and the radical are the same, so remembering the meaning of this kanji is as simple as making sure you know the radical for oneself first! If you know the radical, you know this kanji means oneself as well.

- Hint: Make sure you know those radicals, yo!

Your fingers are private, no one can see them unless they pay! And you decide if what they pay is enough to get a peek.

- Hint: Imagine people coming from miles around to pay for a look at your private fingers.

A gold man has one mustache above his lip and one mustache below his lip and keeps all his extra mustaches safely tucked away in a pot. This man is made of gold and has a lot of money. That’s how he can afford to groom two mustaches at the same time. If anything should happen to one, he has plenty of back up mustaches in his mustache storage pot.

- Hint: Picture this double mustachioed gold man as he rifles through his pot of mustaches. Imagine how ticklish they must be.

You have an animal and you say it’s a dog to prevent it from going to prison. Dogs are the only animals that don’t have to go to prison. Your animal is not a dog, but you say it is to prevent it from going to prison.

- Hint: Imagine any animal that’s not a dog. Now imagine dressing it up like a dog so it doesn’t have to go to prison. Practice throwing your voice by saying “woof woof” aloud to help convince people that your animal is actually a dog.

There's a slide with a drunkard above it, and they're making you feel small. And the worst part is that the drunkard is one of your relatives.

- Hint: A slide isn't the safest place for a drunkard to be. You try to help your relative down but they just keep shouting at you and making you feel small. Drunk relatives are the worst.

The sake radical and the sake kanji are exactly the same! Sweet.

- Hint: For goodness sake! Please remember this isn't "sake" as in お酒! It's the English "sake," that rhymes with "bake," "cake," and "steak." Oops.. now I'm hungry.

Your ear listens to your heart and feels shame. Your heart is full of shame for how you’ve lived your life and when your ear hears all the things you’ve done, your ear feels shame too.

- Hint: Feel the shame. Feel the shame in both your ear and your heart. Imagine the things you’ve done to make you feel so much shame.

Next to the scooter, there's a flag warning you that there are sheep around here, so you should go slow.

- Hint: It's also a warning to the sheep that if they want to ride scooters they should also slow down, because as we all know, sheep are speed demons.

A tsunami carries a cross into your soup. Hey tsunami, I was eating that soup!

- Hint: Picture a bowl of soup, but now there is a cross and some tsunami water in it.

The commander's alcohol is really just soy sauce. When he goes out to drink with his troops and they all get drunk together, he manages to have fun and stay sober by drinking down a tasty, non-alcoholic pint of soy sauce.

- Hint: The next time you go to a bar, order yourself a commander's alcohol. It's like saying you want a Roy Rogers or a Shirley Temple, except it isn't pretty and it tastes horrible.

A tsunami, once stopped by a belt, will begin to stagnate. This belt is a belt of water resistance, so the belt stops the tsunami. The belt has caused the tsunami to stagnate.

- Hint: Watch this belt as it stagnated the tsunami. See the belt glow as its enchantment activates, immediately stagnating the tsunami water.

Tie a squid to a knife and you get a sword! Knives are too small to be considered a sword on their own. That's why you strapped a squid to it. They're the right shape, kinda pointed, so no one will know it's just a knife.

- Hint: Imagine creating your own sword out of a knife and a squid.

If you scrape a sharp stone against your skin, it will tear. The sharp stone tears your skin. It hurts!

- Hint: Imagine this sharp stone. Feel its weight in your hand. Now drag the sharp stone against your skin. Feel your skin as it begins to tear. The pain is agonizing.
The <radical>turtle</radical> radical and the <kanji>turtle</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Nice!

If you’re on the edge of a cliff with a snake, you’re unlucky. You’re hanging off the edge of this cliff and you can’t pull yourself back up when you notice a snake approaching your fingers. The snake looks like it’s gonna bite you. How unlucky.

- Hint: What will you do? You can either let go and fall off the cliff, or get bit by the snake if you keep holding on. Man, you’re unlucky.

To make alcohol the key is to ferment it. But, if you ferment it a certain way, it will become vinegar.

- Hint: Imagine making a bunch of vinegar. You use a key to change it from alcohol to vinegar, yum!

You say something and the flowers are right in agreement. The flowers see where you are coming from when you say what you say. You and the flowers are in complete agreement.

- Hint: What did you say to the flowers that you are so in agreement about? Think about what you said.

I’ll give you this bright plate if you agree to an alliance with me. I know you like things that are bright, and I know you like plates too. Therefore, this bright plate should be more than enough to convince you to enter into an alliance with me.

- Hint: Look at this bright plate. Look at it. It’s awesome. It’s blinding. Hold it in your hands. Marvel at it. Wow. This plate is sweet.

The commander radical and the commander kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

The nothing dance is still a dance!

- Hint: If you want to do the nothing dance, just clear your head so there's nothing in it, and then dance!

Your leader gets the blame if your company is in debt. They're the one who led you all into that debt, so they should get the blame too.

- Hint: Picture the leader standing up in front of everyone as they blame him. He's holding a plaque with the amount of debt you're all in. Try to imagine what that number would be.

The leader of your branch became the leader from doing deeds. You can't rise to the rank of branch leader if you don't perform a certain number of deeds! Most of them good, I hope.

- Hint: Picture the leader of your branch doing deeds around your office. Pulling out chairs for people sitting down, emptying the trash, balancing spreadsheets. All good deeds.

A canopy and a helicopter are being compared by a deer. The deer is standing very still (as deer do) and looking very slowly between the empty canopy and the helicopter sitting next to it.

- Hint: Picture the deer comparing the two structures. It probably has no idea what they are, but it's trying very hard to understand what it's seeing anyway.

In prison, when you have access to a big number of fingers, mouths, and legs you can exchange them for things that are worth more to you. What are you gonna do with all these body parts in prison? You should exchange them for cigarettes and toilet alcohol.

- Hint: You just have so many fingers, mouths, and legs you've pummeled off of the other prisoners. Exchange them for better loot!

The fang radical and the fang kanji are exactly the same! Fantastic. Oh, also it means tusk. It means fang and tusk.
