- Hint: Since the fang radical is the same as the fang kanji, that should be easy to remember. Tusks aren’t too different from fangs, so that shouldn’t be too hard to remember either.

There’s a stick next to the sun, reflecting on its former glory. The stick used to be a great tree, and the stick thinks that if it stays by the sun long enough it might return to its former form as a towering tree.

- Hint: Pretend you are the stick. Really focus on your former self as you feel the sun warm you with its rays. Imagine yourself growing, larger and larger.

A boat will have at least one weapon, generally.

- Hint: In general, you can assume a boat will have a weapon, but not all of them will.

When a tsunami comes, the brush makes a good safe haven. Thick brush is a haven from tsunamis because the brush will break the tsunami water and keep you safe and dry.

- Hint: Imagine being in the haven of a brush while a tsunami strikes. Hear the water crash and rush all around you while you remain safe in your haven.

If someone is sick feed them charcoal to heal them. Okay, so maybe you shouldn't feed it directly to them, but charcoal has amazing water filtration powers. So put charcoal in their water and the water will heal them right up.

- Hint: Imagine being sick. Like sick as a dog sick. And then you take some charcoal, put it into your drinking water, and then you're healed!

With a thread, a lion sews together all the rice he'll inherit from his parents one day. He's convinced his parents are going to try to keep some of his inheritance from him, so he's linking it all together so it can't go anywhere.

- Hint: Picture this lion surrounded by the thousands of grains of rice he'll inherit from his parents. He's carefully threading them all together.

When you go on a scooter, anything valuable, you need to leave behind.

- Hint: Rings, necklaces, wallets, phones? Don't take them on a scooter. Leave behind all that valuable stuff!

You tie a piece of thread to your turkey in order to maintain proximity to it. The turkey likes to run away, so you tie a thread to it. This way you can hold the other end and maintain your turkey.

- Hint: Imagine holding onto a thread that is attached to a turkey. Feel the turkey tug against the thread as you struggle to maintain control.

There is a big jackhammer in Nara. That jackhammer is the biggest in all the land and is on display in Nara, Japan.

- Hint: Look at this big jackhammer. Look at it. It’s so big. Also it’s in Nara. Imagine being in Nara and looking at this big jackhammer. You’re all like, dang – that’s a big jackhammer.

You take a tree and slice it until you reach its nucleus. To get to the nucleus of the tree you have to make many a slice, but it’s possible.

- Hint: Imagine slicing this tree smaller and smaller until you finally get to the nucleus of it. It’s super tiny so you have to view it in a microscope. What does it look like?

This canopy, after your departure, will become obsolete. The canopy was here to protect you, but no one will need it once you're gone.

- Hint: During your departure you look back at the obsolete canopy just once. It's standing there, still and alone. It's a really sad sight.

The South Dog gives you an offer. None of the other dogs in the North, East, or West offered you anything.

- Hint: It is well known that dogs in the South are famous for their kindness and hospitality. It's customary to always offer something when a guest arrives.

There is a tsunami in the middle of the open sea. Luckily there are no ships around, so the tsunami in the middle of the open sea is not damaging to anyone.

- Hint: Look at this tsunami in the middle of the open sea. When the tsunami isn’t destroying things and is just out there in the open sea it looks really majestic and pretty.

Stick your fingers in your mohawk and pluck each hair out, one by one.

- Hint: Imagine plucking the hairs out of your mohawk with your fingers. It's kind of hard to grab onto them at first, but eventually you're plucking them like it's nothing.

Escalators are used to reach things.

- Hint: Imagine yourself on an escalator. What is up above that you’re trying to reach?

A leader has clothes that he is quite reliant on. The leader needs his clothes to make him look like a leader. The leader has become more reliant on his clothes than he is on his actual skills as a leader!

- Hint: Imagine this leader in his clothes. Look how reliant he is on them. Imagine what he would be without his clothes – nothing! And also, naked.

Someone threaded a turtle into long skinny pieces, making a rope.

- Hint: A rope made of threaded turtles. Go ahead and grab onto it and see how it feels. A little rough, but strong.

What kind of fish jumps from dirt to dirt? A salmon!

- Hint: When you're at the river watching salmon jumping up stream, they keep jumping onto the dirt, flopping back into the water, then doing it again.

You soak each foot in water before going out in the sun to take your first step. Stepping on the ground when it's been baking in the hot sun can burn your feet, so you're careful to make them wet with water before stepping outside even once.

- Hint: Imagine each step on hot, sun-baked asphalt. The water under your feet sizzles, leaving steaming footprints where you stepped from.

A leader who's humble will stretch in front of everyone. They'll show that they have to get up every hour or so and stretch just like the rest of us.

- Hint: The leader is humble and human, just like the rest of us, and has to stretch to stay healthy too. He's not some kind of god!

column4:
Surname

,

Family Name
column6:
That special woman in your life will eventually take your surname and make it her family name too. Traditionally, a woman will change her last name when she gets married and keep that name for the rest of her life. Her husband’s family name becomes her family name too.

- Hint: Imagine having your surname changed for the rest of your life. How do you feel about having a different family name? Is it a big deal to you or does it not matter much?
The <radical>sweet</radical> radical and the <kanji>sweet</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Double sweet.

You send your private sword man out with your shellfish so he can trade them. Shellfish were used as currency back in the olden days. And you aren't going to go out trading and dirty your own hands, no no. Trading your shellfish is the job for the private sword you hired!

- Hint: Imagine your private sword holding a big bag of shellfish and going off to market to trade them.

A bundle of geoducks is something you can always trust.

- Hint: A bundle of geoducks will never lie, never let you down, and never disappoint you. You can trust them completely.

You run and call out to people at the same time because you're super ultra excited right now. You have a super crazy amount of energy you need to get out with your running and calling.

- Hint: You're going for an ultra run, calling out with your super loud voice right down the middle of the street.

You want to put this towel over this scarecrow, but you have to measure its width first. If the towel doesn't have a greater width than the scarecrow, some of it will be showing. Which you definitely don't want.

- Hint: The scarecrow creeps you out. You don't want to look at it anymore, so you're standing eerily close to it measuring its width, so you can hide it forever.

A skewer to the heart has afflicted your health. You’ve been afflicted with a disease from the skewer to your heart. Your affliction is death. You’re dying.

- Hint: You did not wish to be afflicted as such. Feel the skewer in your heart and the great pain it gives you. You know you’re dying.

You see an animal wearing a top hat and decide to aim at it. The top hat is a perfect, giant target you use to take down this animal.

- Hint: It's much easier to aim for an animal wearing a top hat than one without.

This building is full of cars because it's an army base. The cars (and tanks and planes) need to be ready to go at any moment just like the soldiers.

- Hint: Picture a giant army base housing all of the different cars the army needs at any given time.

column4:
Base

,

Baseball Base
column6:
There's an explosion in the dirt under a rice paddy, exposing the hidden base under there. A base from baseball! I guess this rice paddy was built on top of an old baseball field...

- Hint: Picture a serene rice paddy. Now watch the whole thing explode, rice and dirt going everywhere, and a secret, underground baseball base is left there, smoldering.

What's more simple than a bow? A bullet. Bullets just have to be shot out of a gun and somebody dies. Bows you have to load with an arrow and pull it back and aim, yuck. Bullets are the new bows, people.

- Hint: Imagine how simple life would be if we replaced all the bows in the world with bullets. (Insert sarcastic crying face here.)

You brought flowers to place on top of the place where a yakuza took a spoon and killed twenty people, and there is now a burial happening. You carefully toss the flowers in with the dirt and everything is buried together.

- Hint: This is the biggest burial you've ever seen. The hole is huge. It has to fit twenty people, after all, and the spoon didn't cut them up to make things any easier.

You take your fingers and slam a lid on the table. You make this big noise to confront the person in front of you.

- Hint: They weren't listening, which is why you slammed that lid down. You'll have to confront them more directly.

Below this mountain, a moon and another moon crash into each other and the entire thing crumbles to pieces.

- Hint: Watch as the moons crumble together, and then the mountain slowly crumbles down into them too.

On the scooter is an insect and a bear. The bear immediately stomps the insect, squishing it flat. "My god, the insect is smashed. Someone call dispatch!"

- Hint: Imagine the conversation with emergency services. They say they will dispatch an ambulance immediately.

You're in prison, but you can use your fingers and a spoon in the light of the sun to display little moving pictures on your cell wall. It's like a shadow puppet display except you can only make a few characters with your limited hand tools.

- Hint: Imagine displaying your two favorite characters in the shadows on your prison cell walls. This one is mister fingers and this one is missus spoon. They're best friends.

If you combine fire with violence, it will explode! A fire, once full of violence, will surely explode. The fire can’t handle all that violence so the fire just rumbles and shakes and then finally explodes. BOOM!

- Hint: Imagine the fire explode. Feel the heat of the fire and the explosion. It’s very violent. BOOM BOOM BA-BOOM!

You're holding a flag on a stick above your eyes to imitate eyebrows. You can't grow any of your own, but you really love eyebrows, so this was the best you could do.

- Hint: Look at yourself in the mirror. You can see the stick holding up the flag and it's very clear you drew some eyebrows onto the flag with some markers, but you still look pretty good (in your opinion).

You carry a cross across a rice paddy with a heart on it to return a favor for your friend. The heart needs to be purified so that’s why you have it on the cross and your friend lives on a rice paddy farm so that’s why you’re running through that. The favor you are paying your friend back with is getting him this heart. He needs a new one and you’re providing it.

- Hint: This is a pretty big favor. Imagine running through a rice paddy carrying a cross with a warm beating heart on it. Thump thump. Thump thump.

A tsunami pushes all the fish closer to land, making for some easy fishing. The tsunami starts out in the middle of the ocean and pushes all the fish towards the coast where everyone does their fishing. With all the fish pushed closer to land and closer together, it’s very easy for people to go fishing in one spot and catch a lot of fish.

- Hint: Imagine going fishing for fish in a fishing spot after a tsunami. There are SO many fish here. Your hook barely touches the water and there’s already a fish on it. Man, fishing like this is easy! Smell the smell of fish and sea air around you.

Grain left in the sun blossom and give off a wonderful fragrance. They smell fresh and delicious. There's nothing better than the fragrance of fresh, sun-kissed grain.

- Hint: Imagine this warm, grain fragrance. What does it smell like to you? Cooked rice? Gentle flowers? A warm summer's day?

A tsunami dug out a chunk of the land and now it looks like a big red bow. It's a gulf now!

- Hint: Picture all the famous gulfs you learned about in geography class. Most of them look like someone pressed a bow into them and dug out the land. (And just imagine they're red because the earth is bleeding, making the sand red.)

Your foot heard an omen and now it's making you hop over things.

- Hint: Imagine your foot hearing this omen, "If you step on a crack, you'll break your mother's back." Now your foot hops over all of the tiny cracks in the street and the sidewalk and you look really silly.

Take your fingers and wrap them around another person. This is called a hug. Just make sure you include all the stuff attached to your fingers, like your hands and arms too, otherwise it's more of a squeeze, and we don't want to do that to people.

- Hint: Picture it like you're a baby who is new to hugs. You start with your fingers, spread them out and move forward. Now wrap all that stuff attached to your fingers around another person. You did it! You're hugging now!

column4:
In Season

,

Time Of Month

,

Season
column6:
Put the sun in prison and everything will always be in season. If the sun is in prison, the seasons can't change. Want to wear a giant weenie costume all year round? Put the sun in prison on Halloween. Now your weenie body is always in season because it's always the same time of month.

- Hint: You're welcome. Now you know how to keep everything in season. Lifehack!

When your ear is crossed with sound, it catches it like a net, and sends it to your heart for processing. Because you're using your heart to process this sound, it means you're giving it a proper listen.

- Hint: Imagine the whole process of sound going through your ear and to your heart, then the gears turning to really understand what someone is saying. It's a real listen, not a fake non-heart listen.

You give your servant a gun along with some other products to look to. You can’t look to them yourself since you are very busy. You allow your servant to look to your gun and the other products.

- Hint: Imagine your servant as he looks to your gun and products. You can always look to him to take care of your menial tasks. You feel smug.

The omen radical and the omen kanji are the same!

- Hint: If you know the omen radical, you know the omen kanji as well!

The weight of life on your sword is big when you pledge to protect your city. That's the big, big weight of every single person's life in that city pressing down on you every time you take out that sword.

- Hint: Imagine holding up your sword and pledging to protect the lives of everyone in this city. It's a big deal!

Destroy a lantern with your knife and you'll be punished.

- Hint: Even if it was your own lantern, why stab it with a knife? You could have recycled that. I will punish you for lantern stabbing and pollution!

A greenhouse is the newest power of the city you decided to recruit. You’re trying to recruit all the buildings in town and the greenhouse was the next on your list. It adds just a little bit of power to the town, but it's important nonetheless.

- Hint: Imagine what you had to do to recruit this greenhouse. Imagine schmoozing with the previous greenhouse owners to recruit them to your cause and sell you the greenhouse.

The leader presents you with a prize as reparation for his past deeds. This leader wronged you in the past and wishes to make amends. Therefore the leader presents you with a reparation in the form of a glittering prize.

- Hint: Imagine receiving your reparation prize. Feel the prize in your hand. It’s all wrapped up but it’s heavy and feels expensive. What could it be?

Everyone from your clan puts their fingers in the ground as a way to resist their lords. Your clan is made of a bunch of peasants, but you aren't going to work the land for other people anymore. You're going to resist. This is a protest! Your fingers work for no one but yourselves from now on!

- Hint: Imagine your entire clan putting their fingers in the ground in unison as a form of resistance. It's a moving sight.

This door is big and you need to return it to its rightful owner. This door is too big and important looking to not belong to someone. You need to find its owner and return it to them.

- Hint: Heft this big door in your arms. It’s very heavy. Feel your arms tire as you look for who to return the door to.

The sun calls out to the earth by shining down on it.

- Hint: The sun doesn't have a voice, unfortunately, so it calls out the only way it can, with its shining rays.

The skewer radical and the skewer kanji are exactly the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo.

At this gate you're trying to get some beans through, but the measurements were off and you're starting to struggle. No matter how you push or pull these beans, they're just too big to get through the gate.

- Hint: "I'm really struggling here, I thought you said you measured these beans?" you ask the bean seller. "I did! I mean, I struggled with the measurements, I'm not very good at math..." Ugh.

Happiness is a circle that's tenacious. In other words, we're all in this circle/cycle where we do whatever we can to grab onto happiness and hold it as tightly as we can.

- Hint: Be tenacious about happiness in your life. No matter how many times it slips away, don't give up. Keep going after it, because it will absolutely come back if you're tenacious enough.

Your foot is a little red and you can see traces of ink streaked on it. Where did these traces come from?

- Hint: You look closer at your foot, examining the traces of red ink, and slowly the night before comes back to you.

A triceratops with a moon knife can whittle down anything.

- Hint: Imagine the triceratops with its little moon knife, doing some whittling. Hand it anything and it will whittle it down.

A leader asks half of his men to accompany him on a secret mission. The leader’s mission is volunteer only, so it’s impressive that he got half of his men to accompany him.

- Hint: Imagine you are one of the leader’s men who volunteered. What made you want to accompany him? Imagine the good qualities of this leader and how he inspired you to accompany him on this mission.

You get tooth orders. You get these tooth orders various times in your life, depending on your age.

- Hint: You get baby age tooth orders (to get your first teeth). You get child age tooth orders (to get your adult teeth). Then you get old age tooth orders (when you start losing your teeth). There are tooth orders for every age.

By showing the roof of your top hat you send your best regards.

- Hint: Giving your best regards is basically just tipping your hat and showing the roof of it.

Your mouth has a tooth that you use to bite and chew with.

- Hint: Imagine that one tooth in your mouth chewing through everything. It's not easy to chew with only one tooth, but luckily yours is huge and razor-sharp, so it helps you to bite and chew your way through anything you like.

The more shellfish you have, the more you can bribe people. That worked in the olden days when shells were money, and today too if the people you want to bribe really like seafood.

- Hint: Imagine bribing a bunch of yakuza and politicians with all the shellfish you have. Ohohoh, you'll never be caught!

Someone is offering you a shellfish in exchange for a kiss. This is a bribe! You don't want to kiss them, but that shellfish sure looks tasty.

- Hint: "Come on, don't you want this shellfish?" they ask, shaking it up and down at you.

The door in that direction is among a cluster of doors. You run in the direction of the cluster and one door stands out to you. You enter it.

- Hint: Imagine seeing all these doors, this cluster of doors. You feel confused at which one to enter but finally pick one. Hear the door creak as you open it.

A tiger needs to think and consider its actions before it attacks. Tigers are smart hunters, so they need to consider all options and really think through a situation.

- Hint: Look at this tiger as it approaches you. Think what things it has to consider. It has to consider how big of a threat you are and so on. You need to consider how you’re going to escape from this tiger.

They say if you put things on a slide, seven things to be exact, that’s the best way to consign goods to someone. They say if you consign seven things to someone, you should send them over on a slide. Slide ‘em on down. All seven of ‘em.

- Hint: Imagine what seven things you consign over to this other person for safekeeping. Visualize them in your head as you slide each one down the slide.

Past stamps usually depict images contrary to current views.

- Hint: Look at this stamp. There's Columbus being hugged by a bunch of South American natives. Yikes, that's contrary to how things went, that's for sure.

In the rain I take my rake and shake it, making a demand that the rain stop! I demand this rain stop right now! Don’t make me shake my rake more violently than I am currently shaking it!

- Hint: Go out into the rain and shake your rake. Imagine shouting your demand at the sky as the rain pelts you from above.

column4:
Disc

,

Jade Disc
column6:
You offer a hot pepper to the king, and he gives you a drop of something. You look down at the drop to see it transforming into a disc. And not just any old disc at that. It's a jade disc.

Have you ever seen ancient Chinese jade discs with holes in the middle? That's what this kanji is referring to.

- Hint: You took a long time to pick out the perfect hot pepper. Only the best for the king, right? It burned your hands a little as you held it on your way to the palace. You were hoping for something pretty special in return, but you never imagined it would be a drop that magically turns into a disc. Wow!

A mole in winter will do whatever you ask, if you know how to ask it.

- Hint: They do most of their own chores during the rest of the year, so winter is when you should ask them to do things for you.

You're on a scooter and suddenly someone throws a hot pepper at you and you have to dodge it.

- Hint: Imagine riding your scooter, dodging multiple hot peppers as they're tossed at you. A few of them get stuck in the wheels and keep coming around and around, and you have to dodge them too.

When you see flowers in a rice paddy you can't help but use your fingers to draw them. Have you ever seen rice paddy flowers? They're beautiful. And if you can draw them you can capture that beauty and show it to everyone.

- Hint: Imagine using your fingers to draw these rice paddy flowers. Don't worry about how well you can draw, this is so beautiful, anyone could capture it.

You got your copy of "The Dry Knife." It's the newest edition of the magazine you love on keeping your knives dry.

- Hint: You're really into this magazine, and when you heard there's a new edition of it, you went out and bought it right away.

You use your scooter when the omen comes so that you can escape.

- Hint: Unfortunately, the omen is riding a scooter too, so you're going to have to be crafty to escape this omen properly.

Where do you put your fingers when you're on an escalator? On the handle! Okay, so maybe it's not a handle and more of a railing, but for the sake of this kanji, picture a handle instead.

- Hint: Imagine being on an escalator and wrapping your fingers around a small handle on your way up or down. It's still a bit precarious, truth be told.

If there’s a drop on your head and the rice is big, you know you’re in the interior. And by interior, I mean you’re actually inside someone. The rice is big because you’ve shrunk to a tiny size and are inside someone’s stomach. The drop on your head is actually digestive fluid.

- Hint: Imagine being in the interior of someone’s tummy. See the big pieces of rice all around you as drops of stomach fluid continue to drop down on your head.

A leader with horns takes a lantern and searches for people to join him. He needs more people to join his cause so he can get his horns removed. He’s embarrassed of them which is why he only travels at night, hence the lantern.

- Hint: Imagine this shady leader approaching you in the night. The lantern light shines in your face. Would you join him?

Under the moon beneath a tree there is a hat filled with water. You stare down into the water and decide to stick your knee in it.

- Hint: Feel the water splash over your knee as you stick it into this hat. It fits really well, the hat is the perfect size for your knee. Now look up at the moonlight filtering through the tree above.

You change this geoduck because you want it to lean. Right now it's standing up straight, but you want it to lean to one side instead.

- Hint: Why do you want this geoduck to lean? Try to come up with your own reason. And why don't you look up what a geoduck looks like one more time for good measure. You don't want to be able to get this image out of your head.

The thread on this football is loose. We need to tighten up the loose thread on this football or it’s gonna fall apart while we’re playing.

- Hint: Look at this football. The thread is loose on the football and needs to be tightened. Attempt to tighten the loose thread on the football as you hold it in your hands.

When it's spring in heaven they play music. To your mortal, human ears it sounds more like snow melting, birds chirping, and plants waking up.

- Hint: Close your eyes and imagine all of the spring sounds that come down to you from heaven in the springtime. Mmm, you can almost smell the damp soil and rain.

A woman who has a landslide getting ready inside her is pregnant. And that baby is gonna come out like a landslide.

- Hint: Picture an ultrasound of the pregnant woman, but instead of a little baby heartbeat, you hear a scary roaring sound. That's what being pregnant is like. Waiting for the landslide to come.

A woman sleeps with the king and becomes pregnant. Only the king wasn’t human and now the woman is pregnant with a hybrid alien baby!

- Hint: The king radical is slightly altered in this kanji, so just remember that the king is a strange alien and not human. Imagine being this woman and having this half-breed alien baby inside you. Feels weird.

You put on the shellfish mask once per year and break into people's beach houses, leaving behind presents.

- Hint: You're like beach santa, except you're real and you wear a mask made of shellfish.

Shove your fingers into a bowl of shrimp to select the best one. You know your shrimp and you know them well, so you won't settle for anything less than the best. Put your whole arm in there and feel around until you can select the one you want most.

- Hint: Feel your fingers touching each and every shrimp, one by one, until they graze the one you select as the perfect shrimp. Slowly pull it out and lower it into your mouth. Munch munch... ahhh! The perfect shrimp.

There's a scooter coming toward you with a net trapping a weird zombie on it. You don't want this here, so you decide to send back the zombie.

- Hint: You want to send back this zombie the way it came. You definitely don't want it loose in your neighborhood.

You have thread and some syrup and you need to spin them together. Drip the syrup onto the thread and spin it around and around over your head.

- Hint: Imagine carefully dripping syrup onto a thread and then spinning it in a circle.

Use your fingers on the cat pirate to suppress him. The cat pirate was attacking you, so you took your fingers and pet his head and scratched his chin. Now he's calm and suppressed. He doesn't even remember why he was attacking you.

- Hint: Imagine suppressing a cat pirate with your own fingers. His fur is so soft, but his nails are so sharp!

In your prefecture, you come from a long lineage of people who share one heart. When the heart is passed on to the next in line, it flies out of their body, and suspends itself in the sky, for you to take.

- Hint: You see the suspended heart in the distance, and make your way towards it.

You take a grain and fashion it into a gun that is small, earning you the title of Small Arms Dealer (or SAD). Congratulations!

- Hint: This isn't exactly a title you're proud of, in fact, you're really embarrassed. Maybe you can make a name for yourself in something else so you can get a new title.

You thread someone together with thread. Someone is falling apart so you use thread to put them back together.

- Hint: Imagine taking some thread and putting someone back together with it. It’s awfully messy. I hope you’re good with blood.

column4:
Tray

,

Platter

,

Board
column6:
Your boat holds your weapon like a plate. So in a way, it's just a tray for your weapon.

- Hint: A big boat shaped like a plate is just a tray. You keep your weapons on it, nice and flat.

Raise your fingers to the sky to symbolize that you abstain from something. If someone offers you fur coats, raise your fingers to abstain. If someone tries to get you to bully someone, raise your fingers to abstain.

- Hint: Abstaining from doing what other people are doing is important sometimes. So make sure you never forget the universal abstaining symbol.

On your roof every evening you meet with snakes. All snakes know your address.

- Hint: You're snake famous. Snakes go on a pilgrimage to your address every evening. Your address is passed down from snake generation to snake generation.

The allocate radical and the allocate kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

column4:
Bitter

,

Astringent

,

Reluctant
column6:
There's a tsunami coming and you can't stop the explosion of bitterness in your mouth. You're scared. Your mouth tastes bitter and astringent.

This word also means reluctant, because wouldn't you be reluctant to let a tsunami come wash you away with that bitter explosion of flavor in your mouth?

- Hint: You're reluctant to face this bitter end at the hands of a tsunami.

A mountain branch will branch off from the rest.

- Hint: Picture this part of the mountain, branching off from the rest, into a mysterious path of its own.

The dirt next to your village is where you bury the dead. People don't live forever, so every village has a patch of dirt specifically used for burying dead things.

- Hint: Imagine the village where you grew up. Can you see the dirt area where all your ancestors were buried?

column4:
Buzzer

,

Small Bell
column6:
You take gold in exchange for executing orders to construct a buzzer. You are a small bell maker and someone orders you to make one into a buzzer in exchange for some gold. This is how you make a living.

- Hint: Imagine the gold, heavy in your pockets, as you construct this buzzer with your bare hands. Feel the cool metal clink around in your hands as you put it together.

There is something odd sticking out of the dirt. Oh wait, it's just the cape jutting out into the water below. Phew.

- Hint: It's just the cape sticking out into the sea. Haha, for a second... you thought... no...

A tree crab breaks into your games cabinet and steals a chess piece. He’s trying to impress all his tree crabs back home by showing how not afraid of humans he is. Plus the rest of the tree crabs need one last chess piece to complete their set.

- Hint: Imagine finding this tree crab in your games cabinet trying to make off with your chess piece. This tree crab is big and you weren’t expecting to find it in your games cabinet so you’re kind of terrified. You scream in horror.

When you say "Nurse!" you're ready to defer to them.

- Hint: If you say "nurse" you're asking something of a nurse. For this story, pretend like you don't know what to do, so you're going to defer to their skill and let them take over.

Whenever a turkey comes in the door, you employ them.

- Hint: Imagine hundreds of turkeys walking in. The word has gotten out amongst the turkey community that if they walk through your door, you'll employ them.

The excuse radical and the excuse kanji are exactly the same! Dandy!

- Hint: Know your radicals, stop making excuses.

Your buddy the sheep is part of a flock. A flock of sheep. Your sheep buddy is a member of a flock.

- Hint: Imagine following your sheep buddy back to his flock. Feel the soft fur of all the sheep around you as they baa peacefully.

In a tree on nine branches are some cross frames. Each cross frame is hung on the branches of the tree. You don’t know who decided to hang the frames there, but you think it might be some new wave art or something. Actually you need a frame, and there are already nine up there, so you decide to take one.

- Hint: Feel the tree bark under your palms as you climb up the tree to take a frame. You get a splinter from grabbing the frame. It really smarts.

You need to allocate enough gold to buy a gun. Guns are weapons of the old world, so you can't just buy them with paper money. Guns have to be bought with gold coins and slabs and bricks.

- Hint: Picture yourself handing over an armful of gold bars to buy a single gun.

A leader who lives in a mountain is a hermit. The only thing this hermit is a leader of now is mountain goats. This hermit dislikes people so that’s why he lives in a mountain now.

- Hint: Imagine this odd hermit leading mountain goats around the mountain, marching to the beat of a drum. It’s a strange sight indeed.

There are three slides sticking out of this building that lead to your home country. The rest of the slides go to other places, but three are yours.

- Hint: Imagine standing at the top of the building and looking down at the three slides that stretch off toward your home country. It takes a few hours to slide all the way there, but at the end you'll be home.

You loiter around with a gun while your friend tries to correct a stamp to make it more honorable. Someone messed with the stamp machine and your friend is trying to correct the error. You’re loitering around with a gun since you’re his bodyguard. To have an error on the stamp would not be honorable, so that’s why your friend is going to correct it.

- Hint: Feel the weight of the gun in your hands as your friend works to make the stamp honorable again. Listen to your friend complain about how there are so few people left in the world that are honorable. Also keep in mind that the correct radical is a little different with the vertical line going through the top, so just think of that as the error trying to be corrected.

When someone wants to view the reality of your soul, show it with humility. Because the reality is... our souls are all a little dirty. And we haven't been the best versions we could be. So make sure when you show all of yourself you do so with some humility.

- Hint: Focus on the feeling of humility here. You're putting it all out there, you know? With nowhere to hide.

You use your foot to kick Wolverine in the face so a turkey can leap to freedom. This turkey is trying to escape from Wolverine by leaping over a fence. Wolverine doesn’t want the turkey to escape, but you kick him with your foot and the turkey is then free to leap to safety.

- Hint: Imagine kicking Wolverine in the head with your foot as the turkey makes turkey sounds in the background. He’s taller than you so you must leap as you kick.

They say Mona Lisa had more modesty than any other woman at the time.

- Hint: Leonardo da Vinci picked her for her modesty. She's so modest she shows no emotion.

A drop of rain falls on a bear leaning up against a cross stuck into a mound. The drop wakes the bear up and he rolls down off the mound. After the bear rights himself, he assumes that the cross pushed him off the mound so he charges into the cross atop the mound and knocks it over.

- Hint: Imagine this whole scene. A drop of water rouses the bear and he becomes enraged after he rolls down the mound. Hear the bear roar with anger as he charges up the mound and violently smashes the cross into the ground.

The one sided radical and the one sided kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

Construction for geoducks doesn't require as much paperwork as construction for humans, but you still need to write at least a paragraph to explain what you're doing.

- Hint: Actually imagine yourself writing one paragraph of explanation to the city so you can get the permits to construct housing for your geoducks. On the form, it specifies you should only write a paragraph.

Criminal writing is always patterned. That is to say, there is a pattern to it, lots of ARGS and GONNA STAB YAs, but it's also patterned beautifully, with a collage of cut out letters.

- Hint: Can you see the patterns in the writing this criminal did? It looks like a quilt or some plaid. It's almost beautiful, the way those death threats are arranged!

A building in winter will allow life to have prosperity. Before we had buildings it was impossible to have any prosperity in winter because everything was cold and most of us died.

- Hint: Picture a dark, bleak winter landscape. No life anywhere. Now turn around and look at the prosperity on display in the building you're in. Everyone is happy and eating food and not freezing to death.

Your mouth contains a scroll, which you pull out and look at. On the scroll is a map, showing the range of the sphere of your mouth.

- Hint: On the map, there is a circle drawn around your mouth showing what range your mouth exists in. Thankfully, your tongue and teeth are within that sphere.

There’s an arrow in that turkey and you do everything in your power to recommend that we don’t eat the turkey. There’s an arrow in this turkey. The arrow looks a little broken, so there’s probably splinters all up inside that turkey. I know you’re all hungry but I can’t recommend eating this bird.

- Hint: You can’t recommend this turkey. It’s probably dangerous. Imagine sending this turkey back in a restaurant, very upset with everything. Also keep in mind that the arrow is half buried in the turkey and looks a little broken since the arrow radical is a bit off.

Show your fingers to a giant to show you refuse him. Giants are very big. So big that when you talk they can't really hear what you're saying. Hold up all your fingers so that he can see what you mean.

- Hint: Imagine holding up your fingers to show a giant you're refusing to let him do something. Yeesh, you're brave!

The grain stuck in your cleat had a former life. In that life it was a rice plant. It was a happy little rice plant, minding its own business, when it was yanked up and cleaned up and put in a bag for people to buy and cook and eat. That was so long ago. Now it's just a sad grain in the bottom of your shoe.

- Hint: When you look at a grain of rice, you should think of its former life as a rice plant, not where it ended up.

A big turkey has to measure a safe before he can rob it. If the safe is too big it won’t fit in his getaway van and the robbery will have been a failure. So before the turkey robs the place he needs to measure the safe.

- Hint: Imagine this turkey as he tries to rob this safe. See him with the tape measure as he determines whether or not the safe is too big.

You come across a gold hill. You think you hit it big! You start digging, only to find out that it is merely a paper-thin layer of gold covering a hill of steel.

- Hint: Dig out many other spots. Every time, it's just steel under there.

The turtle shell radical and the turtle shell kanji are exactly the same!

- Hint: Cowabunga!

There are hot peppers hiding in this dirt, so you build a wall to protect yourself from them. Have you ever stepped on a really hot pepper? The oils bleed into your shoes and burn your feet! You don't want anyone stepping on these so you wall them up.

- Hint: Picture yourself walking around and seeing a wall around some dirt. You look inside and there are some hot peppers hiding just below the surface. Phew! Good thing this wall was here to protect you from them.

When a spirit stops protecting you, you'll have to go on welfare. If you can't rely on your family spirit, you'll have to have the help and protection come from somewhere else.

- Hint: The next time you see someone on welfare, be nice. Their spirit stopped protecting them, so they need a little more help right now.

Your fingers have to stand up straight, to protect you from being abducted, or pulled away against your will.

- Hint: You're convinced someone is trying to abduct you, so you need to keep your fingers standing at all times, ready to defend yourself. Your fingers are feeling pretty stiff, but you still keep them standing, just in case.

Every winter you are alert for danger. Everyone knows that the worst monsters come out in the winter so you need to be alert if you want to survive.

- Hint: Imagine yourself out in the winter wilderness. You hear twigs snapping, growling, leaves rustling. You’re incredibly alert and aware of everything going on around you.

You attempt to expel wind out of your mouth but lack the breath to blow out any. You’re using your mouth and trying to blow out some air, but you are failing to do so.

- Hint: Blow some air out of your mouth. It’s easy, right? Imagine what could cause you to fail at this activity.

It's time to do the mouth sun sun chant. That's when you use your mouth to chant sun sun, sun sun, sun sun, over and over until the sun appears.

- Hint: Open your mouth and practice the chant right now! Sun sun, sun sun, sun sun!

If you try to go somewhere but you're too heavy you'll collide with everything. Cars, people, houses. You're too heavy to dodge them, so you collide with it all.

- Hint: Imaging being too heavy to go anywhere without colliding with things.

The drunkard issued twenty commandments to his people.

- Hint: He basically just made up a bunch of commandments to order all the other drunkards around and decided having twenty (twice the amount of that other religion he heard about) would be a good number.

The Mona Lisa is in front of you. "You must all paint the Mona Lisa concurrently," says your art class teacher.

- Hint: Pay close attention to the students around you. Don't go too fast or too slow, or you won't finish concurrently.

The flowers are being worked upon by a tsunami with a specialty for knowing how to dilute things. The tsunami can dilute the flowers by pouring itself onto it. A tsunami can dilute things because it is made of water. You could say that it’s its specialty.

- Hint: Look at the flowers as they begin to dilute. Their color and fragrance and dimensions become weaker and more spread out. It’s really trippy to witness.

When you're driving, you may notice the flags in the dirt near the exits. These flags mark the ditch running along the side of the road. You won't want to try to exit the road here or you'll end up stuck in one.

- Hint: Picture the flags in the dirt. Picture the ditch just over the edge of them. Now look for another way to exit this road, cause that way is just not a good idea.

Simultaneously, you throw your knife at another person who's throwing a knife at you and you both get a dose of your own medicine. Literally, there's poison on these knives and now you've both been stabbed.

- Hint: Watch as the dose of poison sinks into your body through the knife that's in your chest, as it simultaneously happens to the other guy too.

A fang on a turkey is elegant. Most turkeys do not have fangs, so this turkey with a fang is quite elegant and dignified. This turkey is special.

- Hint: Look at this turkey with a fang. It’s elegant, but also frightening. See the fanged turkey staring at you menacingly.

Teachers are all around us. Those who came before us are our teachers, so it's important to respect them. This is the basic idea of filial piety.

- Hint: Respect your elders, for they have much to teach us.

You walk by a geoduck a frequent amount. This geoduck really intrigues you, so you can’t help but frequent the area the geoduck is in and walk around.

- Hint: Imagine walking around near this geoduck. This is the best area to frequent when you want to look at the geoduck. Just keep looking at it as you walk.

A horse goes to his favorite district to gallop around. This district has lots of cool buildings and lights to look at, so this horse loves to gallop around there.

- Hint: Hear the horse clip clopping around the district as it continues to gallop. Clip clop, clop clip clop!

The leader of all the spiders is a genius! Spiders are already pretty smart. They can weave complex homes and traps in one web. They even know where not to step so they don't get caught. But the leader knows everything. It made itself a little webbed computer and everything!

- Hint: Imagine seeing the leader of the spiders weaving it's own little spider computer. Doing spider math, and spider chemistry. It's a genius!

A woman is rejoicing. She must be glad and happy to rejoice out loud in front of you like this.

- Hint: Picture a woman rejoicing loudly. She's got a big smile on her face and she wants you and everyone else to see how glad she is.

There’s grass on the ground and the fins there say you have no honor. The fins are left over from the fish you dismembered and they do not believe it was an act of honor. Now they are just sitting on the ground on the grass, calling you out for having no honor.

- Hint: Listen to what the fins have to say as they flop around on the ground in the grass. Hear them swish about as they flop, brushing up against the blades of grass.

You take flowers down a slide to a drunkard that you picked from your luxuriant garden. You picked the flowers from the luxuriant garden, not the drunkard, mind you. Also the drunkard has a cane, but not flowers. That’s why you picked some from your luxuriant garden and slid down your cool slide. Now the drunkard has a cane and some flowers.

- Hint: Imagine picking these flowers from your luxuriant garden then shooting down the slide. There are so many flowers that you are simply overwhelmed by their aroma. Now hand your flowers to the drunkard and watch his face light up as he excitedly thanks you for the gift.

Under the same flag, all the people get together to present a new weapon to your lord. You all bow and say, "Milord, this gift is for you." Because that's the proper way to address your lord.

- Hint: When you address your lord you better say "milord," otherwise you might get beheaded with the weapon you're all giving him.

When you go to the yakuza to fix your problems they'll just multiply.

- Hint: You thought you had problems before? Yikes, now you've done it. The yakuza are just going to make all of your problems multiply!

Inside that building someone is doing a rice dance. That someone is your neighbor.

- Hint: Imagine your neighbor doing a rice dance, whatever that may be, in the building next to yours. That's your neighbor, for ya.

One way to put wheat in your face is with noodles.

- Hint: Imagine yourself shoveling piles of wheaty noodles into your face. They're so wheaty and delicious!

Every winter the thread fields become overgrown. Yes, thread grows in fields these days. And the thread grows the most in the winter because reasons. The thread gets so overgrown that you can’t even walk through it without cutting the thread down with a machete.

- Hint: Imagine trying to wade through this overgrown field of thread. It’s really difficult, and also it’s really cold because it’s winter. You shiver. Imagine chopping the thread down with your machete. Chop chop chop!

You're using your scooter to navigate the flood because you're on patrol. You're one of the few people with a floating scooter, so it's your job to patrol the flood waters and look for people and animals that need help.

- Hint: Imagine patrolling the flood waters on your scooter, which is bubbling and scooting along on the surface of the water. You have to be extremely vigilant in your patrol, you don't want any lives to be lost on your watch.

This tree is the master of a pillar. The pillar is subservient to its tree master because the tree is so great and awesome and big and cool and stuff. The pillar has great respect for its tree master.

- Hint: See the pillar next to the tree master. See the pillar bow over and over in veneration of its tree master.

Use your fingers to shoo a turkey down the stairs and into a portable carrier. You've been trying to get this turkey into the carrier so you can transport it for like, the past hour. You finally got it done with the help of gravity. And, you know, smacking it a bit in the butt with your fingers.

- Hint: Turkeys aren't portable on their own. I mean you could pick one up I guess, but it will bite and poop on you. So get it in a portable carrier first.

Lift the lid off your preserves, kick it, and praise the lord! Your food is preserved, you don't need the lid anymore, praise be!

- Hint: You also praise the lid. And praise the plants and animals that gave you the food.

Raise your fingers to a criminal to reject their request to have your things. If someone is trying to steal something from you, just reject them.

- Hint: "Talk to the hand, I mean, fingers!" you say, refusing the criminal.

A horse is your master and you are merely a resident in his house. How did this horse become your master? Those aren’t questions a resident should ask! Know your place, resident!

- Hint: Imagine having a horse as your master. Hear him neigh out orders to you and the other residents of the horse master’s house.

You employ a geoduck to review all your work.

- Hint: Imagine hiring a geoduck, then ask them to review your work. Please review my writing, geoduck. Please review my record-keeping, geoduck. Please review my taxes, geoduck. This geoduck you employed can review anything for you.

The cow of righteousness is always there for us. He is the cow that must sacrifice himself for us to survive.

- Hint: The reason he is sacrificing himself is so we can all eat! Yum! Thanks to your sacrifice, righteous cow, we all have hamburgers. You should think about all the cows you ask to die for you every day. Maybe say thanks next time.

You see an animal with some flowers and a turkey on a stool trying to seize them. The animal with the flowers is really tall so the turkey needs to stand on the stool in its attempt to seize the flowers.

- Hint: Look at this turkey straining itself on the stool trying to seize the flowers, grunting with effort. You think he’ll ever get them?

If you have gold you also need a guard with a very sharp sword to protect it.

- Hint: You should probably also get some sharp spikes, sharp traps, and sharp spears to keep that gold safe too. Just a bunch of sharp stuff.

Taking a cross, you walk through the rice paddy in the direction of winter and spread your arms wide. You spread your arms to halt the approach of winter because your rice paddy is not done growing yet. You take the cross with you for some extra religious power of persuasion.

- Hint: Imagine facing the direction of the approaching winter while facing away from the rice paddy. Feel the weight of the cross in your hands as you spread your arms and implore the winter to hold off on its arrival.

What kind of woman comes down from heaven? A supernatural one. She is so enchanting.

- Hint: Imagine your idea of what an extremely supernatural woman would look like, and have her come down from heaven towards you. You're totally enchanted by her looks.

The scooter you made out of grains, and are about to ride down the stairs with, is completely transparent. You mashed the grains down so fine that you can see through them! And then you made them into a scooter.

- Hint: Picture this transparent scooter. Well, it's actually a bit hard to see, because it's see-through. I guess imagine the outline and the feel, as you perch at the top of your stairs.

In the trash is a weird looking fruit. Someone decided to abandon it here.

- Hint: Most people abandon fruit when it's misshapen. It's probably fine though...

column4:
Amazing

,

Wonderful

,

Terrible

,

Awful
column6:
Your ice wife is amazing. She's also terrible, because she's very cold and has many ice powers, but that's also part of what makes her amazing!

- Hint: Picture your amazing and terrible ice wife. She's floating in your backyard cackling and shooting ice all around.

Dig up a mole and you attain a mole status. You're always trying to attain a new level for yourself and now you get to be on the mole level!

- Hint: It's actually pretty easy to attain mole status. Just stand in a field. Wait for the ground to move under you and shove your hand in the earth. Blam! An achievement pops up above your head and you're there.

Wipe your fingers on this table in winter to see what it was based on. The cold winter weathers cover the table in frost, and when you wipe it away, you can see traces of what the table was originally based on. All tables have to be based on something, even if it's just other tables that came before them.

- Hint: Imagine tracing your fingers over the table, the cold winter frost stinging them, as you reveal the secrets of this table and what it was based on.

On the insect signpost there is a single sign that says bee.

- Hint: This particular insect signpost points you to where the bee is.

The leader of righteousness is the only one who can run this ceremony. Why? Because it's a very pure ceremony, and only those with an extremely righteous mind can run it.

- Hint: Have him run your ceremony for you. Think about why he is so righteous, then think about an extremely righteous ceremony.

You climb up a mountain and a cliff in search of fire, but all you find is charcoal. You can make fire with the charcoal, but you were hoping to find fire itself. All that climbing for nothing.

- Hint: You’re angry that you could only find charcoal so you take the charcoal in your hands and you crush it atop the cliff on the mountain. Feel the charcoal breaking in your hands as the wind carries the charcoal dust off from the top of the cliff on the mountain.
The <radical>clothes</radical> radical and the <kanji>clothes</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Surprising!

A tsunami carries a husband and his husband up into the sun where they conceal their centaur. The two husbands run a centaur farm, but the local government isn’t too pleased by this so they have to conceal their centaurs in the sun unless they want them to be confiscated by the government.

- Hint: Imagine the tsunami carrying the husbands and the centaur up into the sun. Hear the water gushing as they conceal the centaur up there. That tsunami is gigantic.

The leader gets a nice uniform for the sake of not wanting to look like a fake. The leader is a fake, he just doesn’t want to look like one. He’s not really a leader, but he thinks he should get an official-looking uniform for the sake of not looking like a fake.

- Hint: Look at this fake leader. See him scramble into a uniform. Does he look like a real leader? Or can you tell that he is a fake?

A fire in the rice paddy burns down the field. The rice paddy fire spreads out from the paddy and consumes the field next to it. This rice paddy fire has ravaged your entire farm!

- Hint: Look at this fire burning the rice paddy and the surrounding field. Smell burnt rice in the air as you see the flames dance before your eyes.

A Viking insect is a firefly. In the insect kingdom, the insect most resembling a Viking is undoubtedly the firefly.

- Hint: Imagine this little firefly blinking his firefly light as he flies around shouting a Viking warcry and brandishing an axe. Yaaaargh!

A gladiator turns his hand into a fist. A fist for punching other gladiators.

- Hint: Picture the gladiator squeezing his hand into a tight fist, raising it up and yelling.

Everyone has a poop guy from their hometown. You know. That poop guy. And every single time you try to visit your hometown, poop guy is there making everyone uncomfortable and reminding you why you left in the first place.

- Hint: Picture the poop guy from your hometown. Picture him really vividly. The awkward, rude things he does. The way he smells. The way he makes you never want to come back.

The roof (hive) on a certain insect (a bee) is what protects all of the honey.

- Hint: Bees are a certain insect that build a roof around their honey.

This leader has two things that remind him of his humanity: his shoes, and his hat. These two things remind the leader of his humanity because humans are the only ones who wear shoes and hats.

- Hint: Reflect upon your own humanity. What does it mean to be human? Is it wearing shoes and hats? Probably.

On this scooter is a child who's trying to show that his lineage is humble. All of the other children are going around in fancy cars or helicopters, but this one child wants to be a humble child of the people, so he scoots on a plebeian scooter.

- Hint: Picture this child scooting to his fancy, expensive university in a little suit. Compared to the other kids, his wheels are quite humble!

There is a tiny leader on Wolverine’s forehead sitting on a stool and commanding his troops to invade Wolverine’s brain. These tiny soldiers are going to invade Wolverine’s body in an attempt to destroy him. The leader himself isn’t going to invade Wolverine’s brain, he’s just going to sit on the stool and supervise.

- Hint: Imagine the little leader sitting on Wolverine’s forehead as he shouts “Invade! Invade invade! Invade his brain and destroy the Wolverine!”

Open your mouth. A tiger fell in there on some spikes! That's what you tell everybody, but when they look in your mouth there's nothing there. It's all a big lie!

- Hint: Of course there isn't a tiger in your mouth. And those spikes are just normal teeth. No matter how you look at it, you're saying a lie.

Aside from gold there are a wide variety of other minerals as well.

- Hint: Think of the wide range of minerals there are that aren't gold. There are a lot.

Your mouth proclaims "I am noisy and I am picky!" It keeps repeating this over and over to everyone you pass by.

- Hint: The townsfolk agree with your mouth, you are noisy and you are picky and you need to shut up.

Your leader is also a director so you need to pay respects to him before you can start filming. He’s a huge big-shot and you don’t want to offend him by not paying the proper respects, so you make sure to bow every time you go on stage.

- Hint: Imagine bowing really really low as you walk on set. Don’t look him in the eye! He might get upset. Just do as you’re told!

You decide to loiter next to the trash under the moon in winter so the moon's light will penetrate you. The sky is clearest in winter, and this spot next to the trash happens to get the most of it.

- Hint: Picture a single beam of moonlight penetrating through the winter sky, right onto the trash.

A tsunami hits a bundle of geoducks, swirling around their weird shapes, and creating rapids! The rapids are so violent, some of the geoducks break out of the bundle and get washed into the shallows.

- Hint: Picture the bundle of geoducks getting smashed by the tsunami, breaking apart, and getting tossed around in the rapids.

Your mouth is showy so it makes everybody around you rowdy.

- Hint: Your mouth is showy because it's covered in grills and bright red lipstick. People get rowdy because you're a celebrity and your showy mouth is your signature look, and everyone's so excited to see your mouth in person.

You're digging in the dirt when you find a tiger and a cactus. You keep digging until you realize that these are a part of some big ruins. They're the ruins of tiger and cactus statues. It looks like whoever used to live here worshiped tigers and cacti. Or maybe they ate them. But now their whole civilization is just ruins.

- Hint: Imagine looking through these ruins. Picture the broken tiger and cactus statues. Try to imagine the people who used to live here before it turned to ruins.

The alcohol you take a measurement most carefully of is sake. Sake is very important to the alcohol culture in Japan, so you must make sure to measure it out to the precise amount.

- Hint: Imagine this sake as you measure it out. Hear it pouring out of the bottle as you catch the whiff of sweet alcohol in the air.

You find some fingers from long ago. They must have been set aside by their previous owners. They definitely weren't cut off or anything, someone just decided they didn't want them anymore and set them aside.

- Hint: What would have to happen for you to set aside your own fingers? Try to imagine it right now.

Something you say to someone you become attached to should be said with sincerity. You need to speak with sincerity when you say things to someone who will eventually become your significant other, for example.

- Hint: Imagine saying something with sincerity to someone you want to become important to you. Say something like, “I love you” out loud. Say it with the utmost sincerity.

A tiger has legs that belong to a tiger. You know, a tiger has the legs of a tiger. This is common knowledge. Nothing new here.

- Hint: Look at the tiger running with his tiger legs. So majestic. So fierce.

The boat that oversees other boats, land, and people is usually a warship. They're the big boats that oversee everything around them. And if anyone steps out of line, a warship can take care of it.

- Hint: Picture a huge warship overseeing everything around it. It's big and kinda scary.

You use your fingers to dig through the trash in the light of the moon in winter because you're going through withdrawal. You need your fix and you need it now, so you're willing to freeze your fingers off digging through moonlit trash to get it.

- Hint: Imagine withdrawal this bad, that you're in the trash like this. Close your eyes and feel the cold, smell the stink.

Each tree needs its drum measurement done before you can say it's really made of wood.

- Hint: There are a lot of hoodlums out there that try to dress as trees and confuse people. So make sure you measure their drum before you cut one down or tell someone your secrets under it.

The wrap radical and the wrap kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

You hit a tree with an axe so you can do some analysis on it. To do the analysis on the tree, a cross section needs to be obtained, so you must chop it in half with your axe.

- Hint: Imagine taking this axe in your hands and chopping away at this tree to do your analysis. Hear the chop chop chop as wood chips fly into your face.

Shoot a melon out of a bow and it will fly in a steep arc. Melons are too heavy to fly straight, after all.

- Hint: Imagine shooting a really heavy melon out of a bow. Watch it make an arc through the air. Trace the arc with your finger.

The mole has a knife ready for your arrival. You get out of your airplane, you step on the ground and... ouch! You stepped right on the knife, and there's the mole, sticking it out of the ground. "I checked the schedule for your arrival!" it squeaks happily, and disappears.

- Hint: Welp, your arrival didn't go smoothly. You have a knife in your foot. I'm not sure what you did to make that mole hate you, but you'll have to be more careful next time.

For a car, the reason why it works is because its wheels spin on their axis. That is, they have axles.

- Hint: Imagine a car whose wheels don't turn on their axis. It has no axles. Not a car that will work too well.

If you take a thread and wrap up a bunch of it, so much it becomes a hill of thread, you're going to have a lot of thread. You can wrap some of that thread around other thread to create a much thicker thread. This thread is a cable.

- Hint: Imagine yourself twisting this hill of thread up to make thicker cables. They're strong!

When your fingers move like that, you know it's an omen of a challenge that will face you soon in the future.

- Hint: What kind of challenge is it? If you look closely at your fingers sometimes you can figure out the challenge that is to come based on their movements.

You take a turkey and try to boil it but you char it instead. That's what happens when you throw meat into a pot on high with no water in there.

- Hint: You should know better than to try to boil something without water! Now what are you going to do with this raw, but charred turkey?!

You see a flag near the exit, so you use your fingers to dig there. Most flags mark something, and this exit is pretty obvious, so there must be something under here. At least that's what you think to yourself as you dig.

- Hint: Imagine digging under the flag by the exit of your building with your bare fingers. The dirt is getting under your fingernails as you dig. It's getting on your knees. It's everywhere.

Take this thread and look at this part. Now look at this part! Now look at this part. You don't know where to look! Haha, I have distracted you!

- Hint: You don't know what part of the thread to look at. What a distraction.

This bamboo can be whittled into an example of anything. See, here's a car. Here's a snake. I can make so many examples just with bamboo.

- Hint: It's amazing how fast this guy can whittle!

Someone's fingers touch your tongue and fasten it together. You can't talk. All you can do is make sad tongue-less sounds as you try to figure out who would fasten your tongue like this.

- Hint: Try to fasten your own tongue with your fingers right now. You probably can't do it, right? That's because your fingers are too big and your tongue is too slippery.

Under the canopy, you use a tree for your floor. It also becomes your bed, because hey, what is a floor but the original bed?

- Hint: You lay it down, cut it into slats, and voila! A floor! And a bed!

You use your fingers in a shop to grip what you want to buy.

- Hint: Imagine picking up a few different things in a shop. If something fits nicely in your grip: buy it. If it's too small or too big, put it back.

In the tree district of town you can buy a lot of tree products, including doors. With those doors, though, you always need hinges.

- Hint: Don't forget to buy a hinge. Your door purchase will hinge on your hinges.

If you have fingers it's easy to hoist things above your head. If you don't have fingers, well, it's not so easy.

- Hint: Hoist the sails! Hoist the anchor! Hoist a baby! All of these situations are easier if you have a ton of working fingers. (The more the better.)

A tsunami crashes into the sun (breaking it in half) and creating a different wing of the tsunami all together. This wing crashes down and creates a lagoon.

- Hint: The lagoon is beautiful! The water is hot (from hitting the sun) but it isn't so bright that you'll get a sunburn.

There are flowers and hills in your front lawn. Your lawn is pretty big and it is covered with both flowers and hills. It’s very pretty.

- Hint: Imagine walking through your lawn and smelling all the flowers as you travel over the rolling hills. What a delightful lawn this is.

If the moon is dry, it's good for your liver! Haha, get it? Because there's no moonshine to ruin your liver. Don't drink, kids.

- Hint: Imagine holding an empty bottle up to the moon and seeing it's completely dry. You pat your belly above where your liver is and say, "I guess you're safe tonight, liver."

column4:
Mochi

,

Sticky Rice Cake
column6:
What do you eat if you’re wearing horns and surrounded by lanterns? Mochi (or sticky rice cakes) of course!

- Hint: Imagine yourself in the lantern light wearing horns and eating delicious mochi.

Under the cross is a mouth and another mouth wearing special clothes because they're in mourning.

- Hint: Picture the cross looming overhead, people's mouths open so they can sob loudly, and everyone wearing the same color clothes (just picture whatever color works for your particular culture/religion combo).

You have a thread hill, but the hill is a bit weird looking (take a look at the hill radical in this kanji). It's not any normal hill, it's a weird lumpy hill that isn't quite right. That's because it is a thread hill of netting, and parts of the nets have caught things, like fish and cats, so there's weird abnormal lumps in them.

- Hint: You'll need to differentiate this from 綱, which uses the same radicals (though 綱 has a real hill radical). Just remember that the weird "hill" has stuff caught in it because it is netting.

Even though you’ve old legs, you overcome your disability. These old legs of yours don’t work very well, but you overcome the odds and you run a marathon!

- Hint: Imagine running a marathon with your old legs to prove you can overcome anything. Feel your old legs cramping up as you try to overcome the marathon and finish the race.

The tsunami that is white is the most scary tsunami of all. It doesn't come in and destroy everything. No, it comes in, goes inside your door, then stays at your place overnight, without even asking!

- Hint: Imagine the white tsunami knocking on your door, walking into your house, and then just laying down on your bed. You try to tell it to leave, but it's a tsunami, and it says it will be staying overnight thank you very much.

If you have one stool and another stool, you have a pair of stools. Look at this pair of stools. Look at it.

- Hint: Imagine being in front of this pair of stools. Picture yourself sitting on one stool, getting up, then sitting on the other. Repeat this process.

You walk up to a tree and put dynamite on it. Then you set it off. BOOM. It explodes, but doesn't do what you'd expect. Instead of blowing the tree up, it blasts a very beautiful pattern into the side of it as well as the ground around it.

- Hint: Think about what pattern it might be. Is it a checkered pattern? Something more complicated and beautiful? Whatever it is, think of something that really impresses you.

Put an axe in your mouth with your fingers to express your philosophy. Your philosophy of putting weapons in your mouth. Everyone else seems to think it's a stupid philosophy, so you're showing them that it's not with actions!

- Hint: Imagine expressing your philosophy, your deepest thoughts and beliefs, by putting it in your mouth.

Use simultaneous jackhammers to perform the purification ritual. Two jackhammers running perfectly in sync will purify your body, mind, and soul! (And the ground around you that's being jackhammered.)

- Hint: Close your eyes and feel the purification begin. Try not to let the loud jackhammering sound bother you, just focus on the simultaneous vibrations cleansing you inside and out.

You keep your substitute clothes in a sack. The clothes in the sack are just substitute clothes, so they only come out in emergencies.

- Hint: Look at this sack of substitute clothes. Imagine it filled with all the clothes you hardly ever wear. What kind of clothes would be inside this sack?

You grab a satellite with your fingers and shake it! You're an astronaut and it's your job. Don't worry, the satellite won't break or anything, it's strong for space travel. Just do as you're told and shake the sucker.

- Hint: Imagine being in space and shaking a satellite with your fingers.

A tsunami breaks your bones, not from hitting you, but from making the ground slippery. The water from the tsunami made all the sidewalks and stairs too slippery to walk on, but you tried anyway, slipped, and broke a couple bones.

- Hint: Imagine trying to get back up on the slippery ground. You've already broken a few bones, but you slip again, breaking a few more.

A servant secures a stool in the dirt so that it is a solid sitting device. If you just throw a stool on the ground it will flop over easily. But if you have a servant to dig it into the dirt a bit, it becomes nice and solid and safe for sitting!

- Hint: Picture two stools in your mind. One is solid, you want to sit on it. The other looks like the wind will knock it over. Don't sit on that!

To your car you take an axe. The sun has broken your car for good this time (you think). You're so angry at your car. You think this is permanent. Turns out, though, that it's not permanent. It's just like that temporarily. You did make it permanent by taking an axe to your car, though.

- Hint: Feel sad that you were the one to destroy your car for good, even though the sun messed it up temporarily.

Thread and vines alone are too weak to hold anything up. You need to twist them together to make them strong.

- Hint: Imagine twisting some threads and vines together. Feel them and twist the two tighter together.

Flowers find their death in a river out in the wild. Flowers live on water, but this river drowns the flowers to death. The wild is a dangerous place.

- Hint: Imagine yourself out in the wild wilderness as you hear the flowers screaming until death takes them. The river is raging, there’s nothing you can do to help the flowers. The wild has claimed them.

Imperial clothes allow you to perform an ancient attack that cannot be repelled.

- Hint: IMPERIAL ATTACK, GO! Imagine what this imperial attack might look like and imagine yourself in some swanky imperial clothes while you perform it.

A tsunami can't resist the call of a bog. Whenever a tsunami is headed toward land, a bog will always call out to it, "Hey tsunami, don't you want to hit me with your water? Come this way~"

- Hint: Close your eyes and hear the bog's tempting call.

A good moon is a bright moon. Not just in terms of light, but in mood as well. Like, gee wiz, what a bright, happy moon.

- Hint: Picture the good, good bright moon. Shining and shimmering and smiling down at us on Earth.

Below the canopy of trees is a hand. The hand is just there to chafe against the trees.

- Hint: There's a hand just chafing against some trees. That's... interesting.

You have to run, put your ear on the stool, then run back. That's the charm of this game.

- Hint: Imagine yourself playing this game and basking in the charm of tapping your ear on the stool.

The loitering mountain king who hangs around during winter to provide an indication (this kanji uses the "indication" kanji as its top 2/3rds) of things to come now looks into your heart, and only sees bad things. So, he chastises you about it.

- Hint: "What's in your heart is no good," he chastises you.

We put a flag to remember where we tried to use a jackhammer to measure your friend's heart. Granted, it was a terrible idea, but hopefully that flag of remembrance is some kind of consolation?

- Hint: Obviously it's not good enough consolation. Be furious about this.

A badger, at the root of its heart, is a courteous creature.

- Hint: They may seem gruff and rude at first, but they'll still let you in their home in the middle of winter unannounced and offer you tea, a warm fire, and a place to sleep.

A bamboo stalk looks the same as a big ol' cylinder.

- Hint: Compare the two things in your mind and make them the same.

Hit by a tsunami the drunkard is propelled down a slide where he hits the ground which is covered in fire. He is immediately destroyed.

- Hint: Even if he wasn't saved by the slide (to avoid the tsunami) he would be in trouble. Seems like the world just wanted to destroy this drunkard.

A foot on a giant is a pretty long distance for a normal person to walk. Giants have big feet and can travel large distances very quickly.

- Hint: Compare the distance you can travel with one step compared to a giant. It's a considerable difference in distance.

People had to ride their bamboo plows long ago to enroll in things. There were no cars yet, so they would hitch a cow to their bamboo plow, and dig their way to the government office or school to enroll.

- Hint: Picture the little hut that passed for school long ago. All of the bamboo plows are parked around it, as the people enroll themselves and their kids up for classes.

If the rain touches your foot and gives it a little rain kiss, you know that part of your foot is exposed to the elements. You can also see some dew forming on your exposed foot. So that's what rain kisses are!

- Hint: Ugh, you shouldn't have bought these open toed shoes, at least not during rainy season!

A fire door is a door that leads to something full of fire. That thing is a furnace.

- Hint: Open the fire door and feel the heat of the furnace. Hot!

You've been ordered to spear this tree but you decide to be really gentle instead.

- Hint: Imagine gently poking the tree with your spear. You glance around nervously, hoping no one notices how easy on it you're being.

You hold the roof of the festival up with your fingers but it grates on them. The roof is heavy, and you have to walk to keep up, so the roof is grating on them really, really badly.

- Hint: Have you ever been to a Japanese festival? There's always one of those portable shrines that are basically just roofs people hold up. That's what you're trying to hold with your fingers as the whole thing grates on them.

Two kings are here right now! We need to entertain them otherwise who knows what they'll do. Get out the harp, or something.

- Hint: Imagine yourself playing a harp even though you probably don't know how to. Entertain these kings to the best of your ability, right now. That's why you're doing it and not someone who knows what they're doing. They want it now.

Look at the dirt on the ground at dawn and you'll be able to see all the hedges growing in the area really well. At any other time of day, hedges tend to blend into their surroundings. But at dawn, the shadows the sun makes really helps them stand out.

This hedge also works as a fence. It borders an area and you can't walk through it. A natural fence!

- Hint: Picture yourself leaning over a balcony at dawn, looking at all the hedges appear and their shadows stretch over the ground.

The root of a stamp is to get an instant picture down. Back in the olden days, people had to make seals and draw out things by hand, so stamps came about so you can—BAM—just stamp it and have what you want in an instant.

- Hint: Lots of things have roots from wanting to have something in an instant. Just think about instant ramen. The root of that was to get ramen real, real fast. Similar to stamps, ya know?

A drunkard goes down a slide, hits the ground and bumps into a woman. Who is that woman? It's none other than her majesty.

- Hint: The problem is that you don't want to run into her majesty. That's a grave offense. Feel the fear that you're going to get your head lopped off from running into her.

A (fresh water) tsunami. Some horns. The ground. A bunch of poop. Combine these together and let them decompose a while. You'll have yourself some very nourishing soil.

- Hint: The stuff in horns is great for fertilizer. So is poop. So is water (as long as it's fresh water). So nourishing!

A cow in the winter doesn't like to leave the barn to go to the pasture. It has to, though, because a cow's gotta eat.

- Hint: It's cold outside (it's winter after all). Imagine you having to herd all the cows out to pasture even though they don't want to leave the warm barn.

The sound of spring water always puts you at peace.
