- Hint: Everything from winter is melting and trickling and thawing. All the dripping sounds fill you with a peace you can barely describe.

Take your spoon to the sun to be able to take a bite. It's delicious, you hear. That's the point of the spoon.

- Hint: Taste that delicious sun. It doesn't even burn!

You take out a flag, lay a towel below it, and use your knife to carve the pattern through them both. Voila! This is exactly how old printing presses used to work.

- Hint: The old way of printing involved taking the pattern you want (the flag) pressing it against the place you want to print it (the towel) and then just slicing that sucker on there (with the knife).

The king's hat, not to mention the hair stuck to said hat, is incredibly rare. If you have your hands on either of these things, you'll be a rich duck.

- Hint: Imagine yourself holding a king's hat covered in his hair. Who will you sell it to? This is such a rare item!

column4:
Seal

,

Seal In

,

Closing
column6:
You need to make a measurement of an area so you take two clumps of dirt to seal in each side of your measuring tape, so it stays on the ground. This is the way people used to seal things back in the day, back when we didn't have fancy things like tape and glue.

- Hint: Picture sealing other things with dirt. Like the bricks in your wall. Or the hole in your floor. Dirt can seal in anything.

The simultaneous radical and the simultaneous kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

If a tsunami hits a pirate they are going to sink no matter how good of a pirate captain they are.

- Hint: Tsunamis are big. Pirates are small. Simple as that.

Put your fingers in somebody's business by slapping them! This method also works if someone is getting too involved in your business. Slaps are basically your way of doing business with your fingers.

- Hint: Imagine giving someone a good, hard slap in the face. You're all up in their business now.

When a yakuza takes a knife to clothes, it will of course cause a split or tear.

- Hint: It doesn't matter if it's a yakuza member or not. Any knife will cause a split or tear in clothes.

A small tsunami comes in the morning with the moon. That just means the ocean gets bigger when the moon's out, and that my friends is simply the tide.

- Hint: The moon does affect the tides a bit, so you can imagine the tsunami as the water getting bigger whenever the moon is out. That's just the tide.

This construction project made from shellfish will act as a tribute to the Crabigator.

- Hint: The Crabigator is a sea creature (maybe?), so making a tribute from shellfish makes some sense.

Who will say turkey? Who? WHO???

- Hint: Say "who" over and over again, demanding someone says "turkey," for some reason.

The radical blade and the kanji blade are exactly the same.

- Hint: Please, just know your radicals. Please!

column4:
Can

,

Tin Can
column6:
The radical can is the same as the kanji can. Usually when we talk about a can with this kanji we mean a tin can, though.

- Hint: Picture a tin can in your mind as clearly as you can.

You put a stone into a wrap of some kind. This wrap happens to be a cannon, and you're shooting off the stone, just like I used to do to boats with the cannon we had growing up for some reason.

- Hint: This makes a lot of sense when you think about it, right? The muzzle of the cannon wraps around the rock, then you shoot the rock. Boom!

A bamboo thing you put on your head to stand taller would probably be a hat. A bamboo hat is probably one of those hats you think of when you think of rice farmers, a conical hat.

- Hint: You know the ones I'm talking about? They're cone-shaped, sort of, and they go on your head, keeping the sun off your face.

The dragon radical is the same as this kanji, which is dragon.

- Hint: Not to dragon with it, but make sure you know your radicals so you know your kanji!

column4:
Draw Close

,

Be Imminent
column6:
Your fingers told you that a flood last evening seemed to be imminent, and that there was nothing you could do to stop it. You felt it draw close, coming in the darkness of the evening.

- Hint: Think back to last evening, when your fingers twitched and twisted, warning you as the flood started to draw close.

There's a thread tying wolverine to a pig, balancing them over the edge of a cliff together.

- Hint: Picture wolverine and a pig hanging precariously over the edge. One move the wrong way and they'll both go toppling over.

If someone puts a blade to your heart, you're going to have a rough time. They leave it there, for a long long time. They aren't going to cut you, but you can't move. You have to endure the pain and uncomfortableness of the situation.

- Hint: Imagine your chest and ribs are open. There's a blade on your heart. Now try not to move, or your heart will be cut!

A gold pool is where you're going to go fishing. Because, if the pool is gold, hopefully the fish are too.

- Hint: Imagine yourself fishing in a gold pool, catching golden fish. What a great fishing spot this is.

The good luck radical and the good luck kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

The part of rice that stands up tall in the air (at the end of the stalks) is the grains.

- Hint: If you think about this one it'll make good sense. Just imagine rice stalks standing up into the air.

Your long hair is your friend. It's your hair and you're so proud of it.

- Hint: Just feel your hair, it's such a good friend, and you wish it was longer.

An axe is stuck into the ground on a hill.

- Hint: Imagine climbing up the hill. The sun is coming up behind the axe, silhouetting the whole thing very nicely.

The leader of a big rice paddy is standing in the middle of said rice paddy with an umbrella. Who is this wacky leader? Why, it is I. It is me.

- Hint: Imagine that this leader is you. Be rough about it, because 俺 is the "rougher" version of "I." You should only use it in casual situations or if you're a badass.

column4:
Ladle

,

Dipper

,

Volume
column6:
The ladle radical and the ladle kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

The measurement radical and the measurement kanji are exactly the same.

- Hint: If you make sure to know the radicals, you'll also make sure to know the kanji too, automagically.

The tree has an omen growing from it, one single peach that is the size of a house. Inside is a child who will save the village from demons.

- Hint: Of course, this tree omen of a peach refers to momotaro, the little boy who was born from a peach (you should look it up if you don't know this children's story).

The grain you cut off a tree with a knife is a pear. I don't know if you've ever seen Asian pears, but they're pretty big and sturdy. You can't just pick them off of the tree, you need the help of a knife. That's why this is a pear, and not an apple or peach or something else.

- Hint: Imagine standing below a tree full of pears. You take your knife and carefully cut them all down, one by one.

The woman servant is the lower ranking princess. The queen is no servant. Hecks no. Just the princess, because she's a servant to what her parents tell her to do.

- Hint: Just imagine a princess saying "UGH, I'm just like a servant, I have to do all the crap you tell me." Then, all the servants roll their eyes, because, really, she's a princess, lucky duck.

You use your fingers when you're in private to use an arrow to push open things.

- Hint: You're in private in your own room, no one else is around. Now you wrap your fingers around this big arrow, and you push open your door, your curtains, your windows. It's weird, but you really enjoy this.

A woman loves her catapult for some good ol' fashioned recreation.

- Hint: You ask the woman what she does for fun... for recreation. She says, she goes out and shoots her catapult.

I say, which weighs more: a kilogram of scooters or a kilogram of rice? This is a riddle!

- Hint: Think carefully and see if you can come up with the answer to my riddle before you read on.

The leader of the temple isn't a monk like you'd expect. It's a samurai, who protects the monks in return for prayers that keep him safe.

- Hint: You walk up to a temple and you're surprised to find that there's a samurai guarding it. Talk to him for a while so he can tell you why he has been doing this job. He's quite a nice guy, actually.

From my mouth I have told you seven times not to do that. Now I have to scold you.

- Hint: SEVEN TIMES! You'd think you'd learn.

A tree with two moons on either side, holding the tree up in a horizontal angle, is a shelf.

- Hint: So, your shelf is made up of a tree and two moons. Imagine this shelf and put things on it. The moons are kind of rolling around, making it hard to build your shelf.

You have mouth vines, so you shout! It's hard for you to talk normally, and even harder for people to understand you unless you shout.

- Hint: You were born with mouth vines (a rare condition where your mouth is always full of vines), so you've been shouting all your life. And yet people still can't hear you. It's very frustrating.

column4:
Small Animal

,

Small Animal Counter
column6:
In the cage there are some legs. They are the legs attached to a small animal.

- Hint: You can only see the legs, though, because a cloth is covering the cage. What kind of small animal is it? Try to look.
The <radical>spicy</radical> radical and <kanji>spicy</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Hot!

A flowers fang is the bud that comes out of the ground. It's like a little fang, coming from the earth, and it will become a flower someday. This is a little sprout.

- Hint: Imagine a bunch of these. They look like big fangs poking out of the ground (that is, until they bloom and get into the air).

The mountain wind coming down from the mountains is very fierce. It is so fierce it's a lot like a storm. Well, it is a storm, really.

- Hint: If you think about it makes sense. Those mountain winds that come down from the mountain are cold and windy and nasty. When they mix with warmer air down below, it creates a nasty storm.

A tsunami goes through a little door, and plops down a big drop on your face. This tsunami is your tears inside your eye area. The door is your tear duct. The big drop is the teardrop coming down your eye.

- Hint: Imagine a teardrop going through this process to get out of your eye, though in a more miniature teardrop size.

Rain on a rice paddy means only one thing... thunder! Get off the rice paddy! There's nothing but you to attract the thunder!

- Hint: Imagine hearing the thunder as you run. It is getting closer.

When dirt and flowers suit one another, the flowers grow so tall that they make a tower! A flower tower made of flower power!

- Hint: Imagine walking in the woods and coming across a huge tower made of flowers. It goes so high you can hardly see the top.

The slide to get off this jet is a beautiful, brilliant vermillion color.

- Hint: Vermillion is like an orange red, which is perfect for visibility purposes.

A feather is on a rice paddy, and they are attached together. You put a feather on a rice paddy to create a giant airplane. Flawed, sure. But, this rice paddy + feather is going to be one wing of your amazing aircraft.

- Hint: Imagine a wing that is made of a rice paddy and a feather put together. Doesn't make sense, looks ugly, and probably will not fly. Imagine it anyways. It is your wing.

A spoon to measure a geoduck is a very approximate measurement. Geoducks are big, spoons are small. Still, we'll get the approximation going, right?

- Hint: Do the comparison. A spoonful of geoduck aka a whole geoduck on a spoon. This is a spoonful, right? This is what the recipe wanted, I think...

When you leave grains in your mouth for long enough, they'll turn into flowers of bacteria. These aren't the nice, pretty flowers you'd give your mom on Mother's Day. These are little bacteria flowers that are taking over your mouth. Maybe brush your teeth next time.

- Hint: Imagine how much bacteria would flower in your mouth if you just left grains in there for like, I dunno, a month. That's a lot of nasty bacteria!

Something made of gold stands in a village. It's a bell! The village bell.

- Hint: Every village has a bell of its own, standing tall and proud and shiny in the middle for everyone to see and hear.

The boat radical and the boat kanji are the same!

- Hint: Boats are boats, you know?

The woman who makes your house a home is your bride.

- Hint: She's in your house because you married her. Thus, she's your bride. Your house is now a home.

Looking up to the cliff, you see the trees, and the sun shining down on them. Using the sun and the trees (up there on the cliff), you've devised a method to tell what time of the year it is, based on where the shadow from the trees fall. After a while, you develop a bigger system. This system is a whole calendar.

- Hint: Look at the different shadow patterns. Know what they all mean. This is your very own calendar system.

The sun is being blocked by a rain cloud, making it cloudy.

- Hint: You look up at the sky, trying to find the sun, but it's so cloudy that you can't even find where the sun should be.

An alligator is considerably dangerous. Considerably terrifying too. Considerably [put your scary adjective here].

- Hint: The radical meaning and the kanji meaning aren't the same, but we'll get through this together. Just put a considerable amount of effort into this and you'll learn considerably more quickly.

There's a sock circle in the dirt on your way to cram school. Every day after school you walk straight until you get to the sock circle, you run around it, and then head off in any direction. Somehow it always leads to cram school.

- Hint: Picture the sock circle in the dirt in your mind. Now look up and see cram school through the trees.

From the mouth of your older brother comes... a curse!

- Hint: Imagine him cursing you. He's not a fan of you, since you are siblings, but to think he'd go so far as to put a curse on you? You can't believe it. What kind of curse did he put upon you?

After the tsunami the sun comes out again and shines on these spikes. They were super wet before, but you figure the sun probably dried them off. You lean down to touch them and nope, they's still damp.

- Hint: The sun did a little bit of work, so they aren't wet, but they aren't dry either. They're damp.

The grains you have stored in your house reflect on your earnings. If you earn a lot of money, you have more grains.

- Hint: Imagine looking at the grains in the houses of people who make vastly different earnings. The poor artist has only a few sacks of grain. The rich samurai has an extra house just for holding his grain. That's how you know he has much higher earnings than the artist.

I have sick in my skin. Just look at it, it doesn't look too good. Whenever I have sickness in my skin, I know that I'm probably exhausted.

- Hint: Imagine yourself being really, really exhausted. Then look at your skin. It's all sickly looking.

A sheep with feathers (and presumably wings, too) is able to fly.

- Hint: Imagine the sheep with feathers taking off and flying around. It's an odd sight, but makes sense, kind of.

I'm putting all my shellfish on someone, hoping they'll win the race! This is a gamble and you're gambling.

- Hint: Remember, shellfish used to be used as money. So if you're betting shellfish on someone, you're just gambling. And you probably won't get any of those shellfish back.

Coming down with the rain is two spikes. They go right through two ghosts.

- Hint: The ghosts are pinned to the ground by the spikes, unable to move.

Tsunami vs lifeguard. Who will win? After the water drains away, we find the lifeguard in the gutter.

- Hint: To be fair, it's pretty obvious who would win. Nobody knows what that lifeguard was thinking.

I protect my own animals by going to hunt other animals... like wolves and cougars and such.

- Hint: My animals can't protect themselves, that's why I hunt other animals instead.

If you've been to the moon in the past, you had to get the special stamp on your leg.

- Hint: This leg stamp not only proved you went, but lets everyone around you know you've been to the moon before!

When the tsunami struck, it hit your tent full of beans. When you lost your tent of beans, you had a moment of lucidity. You don't need so much stuff, you can live without it!

- Hint: Then you went back to being crazy. That moment of lucidity was only temporary, and you go back to stockpiling beans.

A dirt demon is just a lump. Just like a dust bunny is just a clump of dust.

- Hint: Picture a lump of dirt. Is there a demon hiding under there? No. It's just a saying, ya nerd.

The animal king? He's just this guy who lives in the forest and thinks he's king of all the animals. He's a lunatic, though.

- Hint: While we're speaking of animals, he's absolutely bat sh*t crazy.

A woman who is a nurse should be called miss.

- Hint: Compare this to a man who is a nurse. You should probably call him mister. That's why you know a woman who is a nurse is "miss."

If you're showing me your "spirit fruit" then you are just naked. You're nude.

- Hint: You know what I mean by "spirit fruit" –– yep, it's out there and you're naked.

An axe is sticking in the ground on top of a mountain. It's sticking into the very peak. Because why would you bother to stick your axe anywhere else on the mountain to prove you climbed it?

- Hint: Picture that axe, jammed into the mountain's peak. The person who did that must have been really cool to get all the way up there.

Below this canopy of trees is a stone. Since it's the only stone here, you make sure to polish it.

- Hint: It's a single, perfectly round stone under this canopy of trees. It didn't start this way, but thanks to all the polishing you did, it has become nice and smooth.

This building now has a cloud over it, creating shade.

- Hint: This shade is really convenient right now, because it's been such a hot day. Ahh, shade is so nice and cool.

The moon table is a table that's made entirely of skin. You thought the table was made of moon, with all those pores and such, but when you look more closely, you realize it's skin. Disgusting, porous, skin.

- Hint: Touch it and feel the "moon table." You know it's not made of moon. How ridiculous.

The cloud floating above a demon has its soul in it. If you can manage to get through to the demon, to make it see that it doesn't have to be evil, it might remember who it is and return to the spirit it once was.

- Hint: Right now, however, the demon is looming over you, and you can't see anything in the cloud above its head. It just looks mad, like it's gonna pummel you or eat you.

The spear radical and the spear kanji are the same!

- Hint: Spears are spears. It makes sense!

When your eye catches an omen, it's only natural that you will stare at it.

- Hint: You don't see omens that often, so of course you're going to stare. We'll imagine what the omen is in the reading mnemonic.

You feel like a stone (again!). When you feel like a stone, your body is feeling very stiff.

- Hint: Touch your stiff body. It feels like a stone.

The toe is early. I hate it when the toes show up early. Well, if the toes are going to show up this early, I guess it's best to put them on the table.

- Hint: See all the toes lined up on the table. They are the ones who showed up early.

If there's a treasure chest, there's always a villain too. The villain is trying to get to the treasure chest before the hero of the story.

- Hint: And the villain always gets to the treasure chest first, often via nefarious means. That villain is SO important when it comes to treasure chests.

A tsunami in the shape of a dragon flies off the cliff, then comes crashing down to the ground. This skinny tsunami of water flying down to the ground is a waterfall.

- Hint: Can you see why a tsunami dragon (especially the Asian skinny snake-like kind) could be a waterfall? Try to imagine it.

The well radical and the well kanji are the same.

- Hint: Make sure you remember that this is a well of water not a "well, actually."

column4:
Black Ink

,

Ink
column6:
You use black dirt to make black ink. That's what you use to write in black!

- Hint: Make sure the dirt you're using to make black ink is really, really black. Like the kind you find around volcanoes or something.

Your eye gets kicked with a cleat that came careening toward your forehead when it popped off someone doing a dance, and you blink.

- Hint: Well, of course you blink, you can't control that. And when a cleat come hurtling toward your eye it blinks automatically.

If a tsunami wraps around itself, the resulting wave will create a lot of bubbles. You know how tsunamis wrap around once gravity kicks in, right? Well when that wave crashes, a whole lot of bubbles are created.

- Hint: Picture the bubbles bursting out of the wrapped up tsunami as it crashes down. The air that the tsunami sucked in while it was wrapping up come out as bubbles big and small.

Some grains get stuck in his cleat, and Wolverine's heart grows calm. Wolverine had been screaming and yelling and stomping around, but when the grains entered his cleat he realized where he was. He was finally able to calm down.

- Hint: He's calm now because he stomped right into a farmer's field (thus the rice) and if he didn't calm down he'd probably ruin it.

You see a child with an umbrella in front of you. Suddenly, they fall straight down into a cavity in the road. It's a big hole!

- Hint: You run over to where the child fell. They are just fine! Because they had an umbrella, they were able to float to the bottom.

This tree is very odd, to say the least. The shape is all crazy, like a lightning bolt stuck into the ground, or something. Oh wait, look at this. I can sit on it really nicely. It's just like a chair!

- Hint: Imagine this odd tree chair being the most comfortable chair you've ever sat on. It's shaped perfectly for you, and the moss makes it soft. Wow, what a chair.

If you pick certain rice or flowers you'll be put in prison. The most famous of these is the chrysanthemum. Chrysanthemums are super important in Japan because they're the symbol of the imperial family. They're even on the cover of Japanese passports. If you get caught picking a chrysanthemum, you're going to prison.

- Hint: Chrysanthemums are really important to the Japanese people. Please don't ever pick them (or rice, because that's stealing food, someone planted that)!

A tsunami causes the capital to become very cool. The capital was already a pretty cool temperature, but with the addition of the water from the tsunami, the capital is now very cool.

- Hint: Imagine being in the capital. The tsunami hits and now you are all wet. You are also very cool because the water is not warm. You are cool and wet. How sad.

The white thread in your towel comes from cotton. We use cotton to make lots of things, like clothes and bedsheets. But white towels are always made from soft, fluffy cotton.

- Hint: Imagine shoving your face into a nice, clean, white cotton towel. Mmm, so fresh.

Below the canopy of trees is a demon. This demon is a devil.

- Hint: You thought the devil hangs out in hell, but he actually hangs out under this canopy of trees.

You need to bring charcoal under this roof to heat the dormitory. You live in this dormitory with a bunch of other kids, and you all have to take turns bringing in the charcoal from outside to heat it.

- Hint: Imagine looking at a dormitory chore wheel and seeing it's your turn to carry in the charcoal this week. Bleh!

There are nine birds and one of them is a dove and another is a pigeon. These nine birds are a flock of all kinds, but the dove and the pigeon are the leaders.

- Hint: Look at these nine birds strutting down the street like they own the place. The dove and pigeon are out in front because they are the most important. Hear them chirping and fluttering their feathers about.

Make barracks out of gold and they will get dull quickly. Gold is soft, it's okay for jewelry and delicate things that aren't used much, but barracks for soldiers? Those are used constantly, and they get worn out easily. What was once shiny gold will go dull in days.

- Hint: Picture a huge barracks made of dull, almost brown, gold. Maybe you should have picked a better material.

You want to turn your gold comb into a weapon, so you throw it into the forge.

- Hint: Once the gold comb has melted down in the forge, you can forge it into whatever weapon you want.

A crab moves a stone because he is playing the game Go. You know this game, right? You put black or white stones on a board until you win the game. This is the Japanese game known as Go. This crab is pretty good.

- Hint: Look at this crab placing stones on the Go board. Hear them click and clack as the crab places them with expert precision.

When you get sick you always eat a hot pepper. It's a habit you've picked up and you can't seem to shake it. One sniffle, one cough, and before you know it, you're eating a hot pepper or two.

- Hint: Imagine if you had a habit of eating hot peppers whenever you thought you might be getting sick. To be fair, it flushes out your sinuses and tastes good, so it's not the worst habit you could have.

column4:
Head of Plant

,

Ear Of Plant
column6:
The part of the grain people favor the most is the head of the plant. You don't eat the stems and leaves of rice or wheat plants, right? You eat the head where the grains are.

- Hint: Imagine yourself walking through a field of rice plants. Now look very closely at the head of the plant in front of you. See the rice bunched up there? That's the good stuff.

I have five things in my mouth and I need them all for me. I own these five things, and I keep them in my mouth so people like you cannot take them from me.

- Hint: What five things would you keep in your mouth to protect them from me? Imagine these five things in your mouth and think of how important they are to you as you taste them on your tongue.

You take some gold and cover your yoga brush in it, turning it into a key. You shove the brush you normally use for yoga into the lock to your car and pour the gold over it. Now it's the right shape to be a key!

- Hint: You lost your old key, you see. But you're a go with the flow type of person, thanks to all the yoga, so you make a new one!

column4:
Lantern Festival

,

Tray
column6:
I found part of a plate at the lantern festival, and put it on a tray to keep it safe. There is a legendary plate broken into three parts. One part of the plate I found was at the lantern festival. The lantern festival was pretty cool, but I’m really glad I found the part of that plate I was looking for.

- Hint: Imagine holding a tray in your hands with this part of the plate on it, as the light from the lanterns glitters off it and dances around, illuminating the background. It’s enchanting.

You're standing under a canopy when you see something strange sticking out of the dirt. You pull it, but it won't budge. You pull harder and harder until the dirt starts rumbling and a giant manor starts rising out of the ground with you on top!

- Hint: Picture yourself on top of this manor that rose out of the ground. The canopy is still above you and it seems to be attached to the roof.

An animal that kicks dirt into people's mouths is a monkey. Monkeys are naughty little things. You should be happy it was just dirt it kicked into your mouth, and not something worse.

- Hint: Imagine looking at a monkey at the zoo. Aww, it's so cute. But then it turns around and kicks some dirt right into your aww-ing mouth. Yuck! Why monkey, why?!

There’s a tree in the east that looks like a pillar. The tree is tall and straight and does not have any leaves or branches. The tree is basically a big wooden pillar that just happens to be alive still.

- Hint: Look at this big tree pillar over in the east. You always know where east is because of it.

"Say 'big,' ground beggar! Have pride!"

- Hint: You are trying to tell a beggar on the ground to say they are big, because you want to make the beggar feel a little pride. "Have pride in your job as a beggar!" you tell them.

Inside your eye stands a tiny village that makes up your pupil. That's the black part of your eye!

- Hint: Oh, did you think your pupil was a hole? No, no, you misunderstand. That's where the village stands. It's full of little people who whisper to your brain what you should see.

On the roof is your heart. OR! In a net in the street. Which would you rather?

- Hint: Would you rather have your heart up on the roof, close to falling but out of the way of people. Or would you rather have your heart in a net, which people can't steal from, but is in the way of cars.

The leader of your sad life aims a kick at the sack you are holding. This leader is in charge of making your life sad. The next step in the leader making your life suck is attempting to kick your sack out of your hands. Your sack holds all your valuables, so it’s not something you want to have kicked.

- Hint: See this leader’s kick coming at your sack. Hear the leader yelling as he aims his kick at your sack. Hiyahhh! Also keep in mind that the life radical is missing the little drop/slide thing on the side. It’s missing that because your life is lousy and sad.

Poop Poop Mountain is covered in poop because it is such a secluded place.

- Hint: A secluded place has no toilets, so you just poop right on the mountain.

With the power of your mouth you command a tree to become a shelf. Most of the time one would have to use their hands and tools to turn a tree into a shelf, but you are capable of turning a tree into a shelf by using the power of your mouth.

- Hint: Imagine using your mouth to turn a tree into a shelf. Yell at this tree and keep yelling at it until you see it become a shelf.

Your village wants to take the village dog and boil it, and you can think of no other response than SHUT UP!

- Hint: The entire village is shouting and yelling and pointing at the poor dog. They're boiling a giant boiling pot of water, and you can't even hear yourself think anymore. Shut up, shut up, shut up!

You use your car and an axe to slice down a pedestrian. This innocent guy is just walking along the road when you drive up to him in your car and axe him to death with your axe. You’re all like, VROOM! AXE! Now this guy is dead because you sliced him down in cold blood.

- Hint: Imagine driving your car, waving your axe out the window and slicing this guy down. Hear his scream ring in your ears as you slice, slice, SLICE.

You stand your towel up so everyone can see it. This announces that you are the sovereign ruler of this bathroom.

- Hint: Whenever someone walks into your bathroom, you start screaming that you are the sovereign ruler of this toilet, this sink, this toothbrush, and all that touch these tiles.

Someone with a top hat comes and tells you that your grains are going to be taxed from now on. Top hat man says there is a tariff that's been enacted on grains. Rice? Triple the price. Wheat? Quadruple.

- Hint: People in top hats like to put tariffs on lots of things. Especially things you need, like grains you eat to stay alive. You have no choice but to pay.

The gold from the east needs tempering before it can be sold. The gold from the east is good, it just needs some tempering before it’s entirely presentable. You know, tempering like you’d do in a forge.

- Hint: Imagine tempering this gold from the east. You’re heat treating the gold when you’re tempering it, so feel the heat from the fire on your face and arms.

If you see a building wearing a giant top hat, beware! This building is a fake and it's trying to thwart all of the plans the people in other buildings have.

- Hint: Picture the building, with it's tall top hat, inching closer to other buildings when no one is looking. It's planning to thwart everything!

You need to stop a drunkard from going down a slide with a jackhammer to ask him how many years old he is. He's doing a lot of dangerous things right now, and they all have age limits.

- Hint: Depending how many years old he is, this guy could be violating like three different laws right now.

You get rain orders. Your orders are to make sure there is zero spill.

- Hint: Despite it raining, your orders are to make sure none (zero!) of the rain spills anywhere. Figure out what you need to do to make sure you follow these rain orders successfully. Zero spill, alright?

That penguin over there seems to have a towel stuffed with cash.

- Hint: The towel the cash is in even has a big $ on it like the ones they have at the bank. You follow the penguin into a back alley.

You give bamboo to someone and they make them into chopsticks. They are very talented at turning bamboo into bamboo chopsticks. This someone is an expert at their profession.

- Hint: Watch this person take ordinary bamboo and transform it into chopsticks right before your eyes. Hear the whooshing and whittling sounds as they form the bamboo into chopsticks with expert speed and precision.

Rub charcoal under your eyes if you want to see clearly. Sports players also rub charcoal under their eyes to see nice and clear in the bright sun.

- Hint: You can even rub charcoal in your eyes if you really want to clear them up, but you should probably only do this under the supervision of your eye doctor.

There is a mountain on top of a bunch of dirt with a steep cliff. This is a bit redundant, but the mountain and the dirt just make the cliff even bigger and steeper and scarier.

- Hint: Imagine a cliff. Now add two big helpings of dirt and a mountain to the top. It's still a cliff, it's just more cliff than before.

Without a fire, you will lack the ability to cook anything. You really need a fire to cook properly. Having a fire will make sure any cooking endeavors you attempt will not fail.

- Hint: Imagine yourself as you cook with a fire very confidently. Knowing you cannot fail, feel the heat and hear the crackling embers of the fire. Smell the delicious smell of whatever you are cooking as well.

Sitting safely under your canopy you take rice and dirt, mix it up, and create unique cosmetics for your face.

- Hint: Imagine mixing dirt and rice together to make some cosmetics that best fit your skin tone and type. No one will see you doing it under this canopy too, so the secret formula you come up with will be safe.

A pig with horns runs into a building and makes it fall into the dirt. This makes a loud crash sound. I mean, how could it not? The building literally crashed to the ground when the horned pig attacked it.

- Hint: Picture a pig with horns crashing into a building and both of them crashing into the dirt. Uh oh, is the pig dead?

A crab will try to hide what it lacks with deceit. Lying, stealing, faking things—no type of deceit is too much for a crab.

- Hint: Covering things up with deceit is pretty much the worst thing you can do, so don't be like this crab.

A tsunami hits your mohawk and it begins to drip. The water from the tsunami continues to drip from your mohawk long after the tsunami has passed. There’s a lot of water in your hair now, so it’s probably going to drip for a while.

- Hint: Imagine having all this tsunami water in your hair. Hear it drip from your mohawk. Drip… drip… drip…

In the dirt there are flags and horns lined up with a lantern attached to them, making a fence. It's a little weird looking, but these things are definitely supposed to fence something in.

- Hint: Can you see the fence made of horns and flags through the light of the lantern?

It's raining on your spear that has winter power. When the warm rain hits your cold, winter spear, it creates fog.

- Hint: When warm water touches a cold spear, fog billows out and covers everything.

After passing through a door, you use a feather to put the finishing touches on a folding fan. The door leads to your folding fan workshop where you make all your folding fans. This folding fan is now complete that you’ve added a feather to it. How lovely it is.

- Hint: Use this folding fan to fan your face. Feel the refreshing breeze as you admire the gorgeous feather you just added. What a fashionista you’ve become.

The door a criminal will get into is the front door. Now hold on, you may be thinking, wouldn't they go for the back door? No! 99% of home invasions happen when you leave your own front door unlocked!

- Hint: You better check the locks on your front door right now, because odds are you left it open and didn't even notice. It's the perfect door for a criminal to get access to your home.

A soul will only inhabit a root if it's holding a grudge. Have you ever seen a nice, haunted tree? No! They're always angry and trying to get someone back for something.

- Hint: Don't die with a grudge, or your soul might end up angry and trapped in some roots.

You take a towel and wrap it around your head to keep the sun out of your eyes. You've invented... the hat!

- Hint: A hat is just a piece of cloth or a towel you get to stay on your head. Extra points if it protect your eyes from the sun.

The soul mask helps you to see the deepest part of anyone's soul. You look around and in all the people you only see hate.

- Hint: You're supposed to see all the emotions, so why do you only see hate inside everyone?

The leader of a narwhal construction crew needs all the help he can get. The narwhals are beginning construction on an underwater city. The leader knows the narwhals are hard construction workers, but they’ll need some help building this city.

- Hint: Imagine being the narwhal leader and asking others for help. Ask a shark for help. Ask a whale for help. Ask a shrimp for help. Go on, ask.

You have fingers in the thousands and while looking up at the sun you decide you want to insert them in there.

- Hint: Hold your thousand+ fingers up to the sun and imagine inserting them into the sun's super-hot ... s-sun lava. (That's what it is, right? Yeah, let's go with that.)

A leader and Wolverine take a slide to Italy. Wolverine’s leader is Professor X, and they are both sliding down a big slide to Italy. How fun!

- Hint: Imagine Wolverine and his leader Professor X going down this slide to Italy. Hear them wooping and cheering as they ride down the slide. Whee~

They say the key to telling a lie is to totally believe the lie yourself. They say that if you believe your own lie, others will believe it as well. This is key.

- Hint: Imagine an actual key going from you to another person. This key is the lie. You gotta believe in the lie for it to reach the other person and unlock their understanding. Visualize this visual lie.

With a woman's mouth, you have a likeness to me.

- Hint: Imagine someone's putting a woman's mouth over your mouth, looking at you, and commenting on your likeness. All it took was this woman's mouth.

A landslide came out of your mouth and created your lips. Before the landslide, you just had a wide open mouth hole.

- Hint: Picture your mouth as an open hole. Now a landslide of something (words? food? something worse?) comes pouring out, and when it's done you have lips. You flap them open and closed to test them out.

A Viking moves your mouth with his hand to manipulate it. He sticks his hand into your mouth. With the Viking's hand in your mouth, he can make you look like you’re saying anything he wants.

- Hint: Imagine the Viking having his hand in your mouth. Taste his salty flesh on your tongue. Imagine him manipulating your mouth and your jaw and making it look like you are saying all sorts of funny things.

A wave crashes into a woman, transforming her into an old woman! The wave washes away all of the woman’s makeup, revealing her to be an old woman. The makeup she had on made her appear to be a much younger woman, but once the wave washed away her makeup, she was revealed for the old woman she is.

- Hint: Imagine a gorgeous woman. Now see her get hit by a wave of water and turn into an old woman. The old woman could still be pretty too, she just looks way old now. Like ancient.

With a lid, you hit yourself in the mouth and then kick it like a pathetic loser. You kick the lid, even though it is your fault that you hit yourself in the mouth with it. It’s not the lid’s fault. You don’t need to kick it. You’re being pathetic.

- Hint: Imagine kicking this lid and with each kick you feel a little bit more pathetic. Your mouth hurts a lot too.

An insect specializing in construction builds a rainbow. Did you ever wonder where rainbows come from? Construction insects build them. Construction insects build rainbows.

- Hint: Imagine this insect with a construction hat on, building a rainbow. He works very fast. The resulting rainbow is beautiful!

A big treasure treasure treasure treasure is refreshing! Sorry, I can’t say treasure treasure treasure treasure without saying it four times. See? I did it again. Anyway, this big treasure treasure treasure treasure is really refreshing. It’s been a long time since you found a treasure treasure treasure treasure, so finding this big one is really refreshing.

- Hint: Imagine finding this big treasure treasure treasure treasure and being really refreshed and relieved and happy. This treasure treasure treasure treasure is so big, you’ll be set for life!

You keep your tongue to your self to give your heart a rest. You’ve been talking and moving your tongue around all day expressing your feelings. This has tired both your tongue and your heart out, so you stop your tongue moving and decide that you need some self rest time.

- Hint: It's important to let yourself rest every now and then, you know.

Before you boil something, make sure that you roast it.

- Hint: Why would you roast something before you boil it? Because that something is tea! Or maybe coffee. Tea leaves and coffee beans are roasted before they're boiled.

column4:
Shaku

,

Japanese Foot
column6:
This shrimp is the exact length of a shaku, or Japanese foot. That’s how they came up with this form of measurement. They measured the length of this shrimp and it was the length of a Japanese foot which they deemed the shaku. It’s equal to 30.3cm, very close to one imperial foot.

- Hint: Imagine this foot long shrimp. It’s pretty big. Imagine it squirming about making a “shaku shaku” sound as it worms about.

Take this stone and throw it at nine crosses to smash them! It's like old-fashioned bowling, but instead of rolling this stone to knock down the crosses, you want to completely smash them to bits!

- Hint: Picture the nine crosses in front of you, lined up in a triangle. Now take your rock, hold it above your head, and SMASH it down on them as hard as you can!!

Your rice fortune is sticky. Rice is sticky. So is your rice fortune. Your fortune of rice is sticky because it is made up entirely of sticky rice.

- Hint: Look at this sticky rice fortune of yours. Run your hands through it and feel the sticky rice between your fingers. Hear the sticky sucking sounds and you stir the sticky rice about.

In the rice paddy there is a forehead with a top hat. It sits atop an area of tatami mats.

- Hint: The meaning you're trying to learn is tatami mat, so focus on the beautiful tatami mats that are strangely in the middle of this rice paddy. On top is a forehead with a top hat. It almost looks like the tatami mats are an altar for this gruesome scene.

The moon is the same as your torso. Because you’re so FAT! AHHAHAHAHAHA. I’m sorry, that was mean. But really, if your torso was as big as the moon, you’d have one large torso, y’know?

- Hint: Imagine if your torso was as large as the moon. You’re a gigantic human. Imagine floating around in space like this. Wooooaaaahhh.

The kanji and the radical are the same, so remembering the meaning of this kanji is as simple as making sure you know the radical for towel first! If you know the radical, you know this kanji means towel as well.

- Hint: Make sure you know those radicals, yo!

There are flowers growing around a heart with a wick sticking out of it. The heart is a sacrifice to the old gods and the life energy bleeds from the burning wick to feed the flowers. The wick burns, releasing the power of the heart which spreads into the ground around the heart causing the flowers to grow.

- Hint: See this morbid scene. As the wick burns you can smell the smell of burning organs. The flowers are pretty though.

A tree that is stamped with one pattern, then stamped with another pattern, over and over, is the willow tree.

- Hint: A willow tree is a tree that looks like it's on repeat over and over again. It also looks nice on a stamp. Note that the first stamp is kind of an ugly looking backwards stamp, and the second stamp is the normal stamp radical.

A scooter with horns with a pig riding on it will be able to accomplish anything.

- Hint: Imagine the pig scooting around. It is able to accomplish anything you can imagine (so go nuts with your imagination).

Flowers are mysteriously appearing in the rice paddy. No matter what you do to them, they continue to amass.

- Hint: Imagine yourself spraying poison on these mysterious flowers, but they just double in size, and continue to amass.

The moon has a lot of power that is power it gets from the power of every armpit of every human on earth! Why does your armpit smell? It’s because the moon is draining the power from your armpit. The moon saps power from your armpit and that power is sucked up into the sky where the moon collects the power for its own devices.

- Hint: Imagine an aura of stinky power traveling from your armpit to the moon. Feel the power leaving you as the moon saps your power through your armpits.

Give a district weapons and it will assault other districts.

- Hint: Picture two districts using weapons to assault each other from above. Like in a video game, with little arrows showing you where they're launching each assault.

Having a foul mouth and horns will prevent you from getting into Heaven where you would blossom into an angel. If you have horns, you are not meant for Heaven and will not blossom there. To blossom in Heaven, you must not have horns or a foul mouth.

- Hint: Swear like a sailor as you imagine yourself with some horns. You’re not going to blossom in Heaven. You’re going to blossom in Hell and become a demon.

Cast a book in gold to make a bowl. Books can be bent into the shape of a bowl, so then all you have to do is pour gold over it to keep it in that shape and ta-da! A bowl has been born!

- Hint: Imagine creating this bowl yourself. Try not to burn your fingers with that hot gold.

Your servant uses a stool to break open shellfish. You know how much work shucking shellfish is so this method is really clever.

- Hint: You knew hiring this servant was a good idea. "Clever girl," you say, as your servant sits on some shellfish again.

You use a cleat to climb a tree and your hair gets the same coloring as the foliage because your hair is like a chameleon. The coloring of your hair changes to whatever color is around you, so you use your cleats to climb trees to make your hair turn green and brown, and in the fall, yellow and orange and red!

- Hint: Imagine digging your cleats into the bark of the tree until you get high enough for your hair to start coloring itself tree colors. It might be a lot of work, but it's worth it.

In this building there's a small sun that's small. They keep this small, small sun inside of a crevice.

- Hint: You wouldn't want to keep a sun out in the open, even if it's small (and small). You'd put it inside something, like a crevice. Imagine walking into the building and seeing the small sun right inside, in a crevice.

You need to put a clown in the dirt if you want to cultivate good crops there. Clowns act as a natural fertilizer, and this will make it super easy to cultivate any crops you could ever want in this dirt. Isn't nature amazing?

- Hint: Imagine burying a dead clown in the dirt and then planting some seeds on top. It's worth it, you think, if it helps cultivate your crops.

Your foot, as your mama says, was given the task to dance. Shake those two foots your mama gave you and dance dance dance!

- Hint: Picture your mama asking you to dance. The two of you pick up and kick your feet to dance, spinning 'round and 'round.

This gate makes the sound of darkness. The gate looks like darkness, but it’s even more creepy that it sounds like darkness too.

- Hint: Imagine this gate making an ominous sound. The sound of darkness. Look deep into the darkness of the gate as you hear the sound it makes. Ouummmmm…

You have a surplus of ladles laid out diagonally in front of you. Why are they diagonal? And why do you have so many ladles? Why the surplus? Hang on, we'll get there.

- Hint: Look at all these ladles lying diagonally in front of you. Pick them up. Feel the wood grain. Wonder why you have so many.

You see shrimp on ice at the market in the morning. "I'll get some on the way home" you think to yourself. Later that evening, you see no shrimp, just ice. The supply of shrimp has been exhausted. It's all gone!

- Hint: Imagine the lack of shrimp on the ice. All you wanted was some delicious shrimp for dinner, but now it's all gone 😩

Rain falls off a tree and lands in your eye where it turns to frost. It turns to frost because it’s super cold outside and your body is freezing. The rain that fell off the tree turns to frost as soon as it hits your eye.

- Hint: Feel the rain hit your eye and then crystalize into frost immediately. The rain in your eye is wet, and then very cold as it becomes frost.

You need to feed this grain to a flower wearing turkey on a stool so you start the harvest. Grains don't pick themselves, you have to harvest them.

- Hint: Picture this fat turkey with flowers on its head, sitting on a stool. It's gobbling for grains and you need to be the one who harvests them.

This canopy of trees isn't actually a canopy of trees at all. When you look closely, you see these trees are actually giant stalks of hemp.

- Hint: Wow, these hemp plants are so big that they look like trees. But, despite their size they're still just hemp.

An odd horse is still a horse. It may look a little funny, but that doesn't change what it is on the inside.

- Hint: Look at this odd horse. Hear it whinny and neigh like a normal horse. It's not so odd, after all.

The landslide measurement humiliates you. You told everyone you couldn't come to work, that your house had been destroyed and your car was carried away, but then scientists measured the landslide, and it only went a few feet.

- Hint: Honestly, that's what you get for lying. But it doesn't make it any less humiliating even if you deserve it.

Fire you use to light up the street needs to go in a lamp. Campfires, matches? No, none of those work. You need bright, safe lamps to keep the street nice at night.

- Hint: Picture these lamps lining the street, with their little fires burning brightly. Nowadays we don't have real fire in them, we use electricity!

In the mysterious rice paddy there is some livestock. This livestock is also mysterious because no one knows where it came from. The mysterious livestock are only seen in the mysterious rice paddy. How mysterious indeed.

- Hint: Examine this mysterious livestock from a distance. Imagine them floating around the mysterious rice paddy like they aren’t even walking. Hear them moo and oink as well.

The tsunami hits your form and you begin to melt. You are a witch and water makes you melt. The tsunami is a lot of water, so once it touches your form, you begin to melt.

- Hint: Feel the water from the tsunami crashing into your form. Feel the water on your body as your form begins to melt. I’m melting! I’m mellltiinnnggg!

The type of insect that ruins your writing is the mosquito. You're trying to write, when you hear that horrible high-pitched mosquito noise in your ear. You jerk your head and swat and it's gone. But when you look down, there's lines all over what you were writing.

- Hint: Imagine sitting at your desk writing when a mosquito starts bzzzzing in your ear. You can't ignore it, it's gonna bite you. So you flail around helplessly.

Take your towel and make it long. It has to be longer than that! For this will be your notebook, which you will write all your notes in.

- Hint: You are making the towel really long, because it's white and it might be good for writing in. It's going to become your notebook.

A tsunami surplus will cover all the dirt with paint. The surplus of tsunamis will strike the paint factories first (everyone knows paint factories are built close to the ocean). Then the paint will flow over all the dirt and paint it a ton of rainbow colors.

- Hint: Picture all of the different colors of paint being swept along by tsunami after tsunami, painting the dirt as it goes.

Your shellfish are worth a fortune because you decided to paste your fortune to the shellfish.

- Hint: Picture all of your riches, your money, your jewels. They're all pasted directly onto all of your shellfish!

The sunlight shines on your forehead in your car with a great radiance. The car you are in is a convertible, so the sunlight shines right onto your big bald forehead. The sun has a pretty powerful radiance as it is, but the sheen from the sunlight hitting your forehead is the most powerful radiance ever witnessed by man.

- Hint: Imagine this radiance emanating from your shiny dome. The radiance is blinding!

When your soul has an idea it's just a recollection of something you already know. Only your brain can have original ideas, so when your soul tries to come up with one, it's just a recollection of something you thought before now.

- Hint: When you have a recollection of some idea or thing in the past, it's just your soul saying, hey remember this? Let's not forget this.

If you try to put your soul into everything, you'll regret it. It's not so much that putting your soul into things is bad, but every single thing? You'll burn out immediately. You won't be able to be good at any of those things. And you'll regret all the time you wasted trying to be the best at everything.

- Hint: Imagine if you went full force into everything you've ever even thought of doing. Imagine how burnt out your soul would be. Imagine all the regret you'd have that you didn't just stick to one thing and do it well.

You take a rake in for a measurement but it is resistant. The rake doesn’t want to have its measurements taken. The rake is resistant to have any measurement taken because it feels inferior to the other rakes and doesn’t want to be embarrassed if it ends up being smaller than the others.

- Hint: Try and move this rake over to the measurement table. It is resistant so you have a hard time moving it. Imagine the rake struggling and resisting endlessly.

On a cliff, the pope is holding a shield. The pope is near the edge of the cliff and is using the shield to fend off demons. The demons want to shove the pope off the cliff, but the pope is using his holy shield of popery to fend them off.

- Hint: Imagine the shield glowing brightly as hymns play in the background. The demons try to get close to the pope to shove him off the cliff but the holy shield is too bright and popey.

There is an insect on the roof in a spoon. It's there for the eating, and it's how you plan to attract a snake to your roof.

- Hint: Snakes love insects, especially when they're ready to eat on a spoon. But, snakes don't usually go on top of the roof, so that's why you have to tempt one with an insect in a spoon.

If the king gives you a knife you become part of his squad. Every king has a knife squad or two protecting him and making sure his subjects keep in line.

- Hint: Imagine if you were given a knife and allowed into the king's squad. Would you let the power corrupt you?

If you have nothing to eat but your ego, you'll starve. You can't eat it, and your ego is keeping you from accepting actual food or help from other people.

- Hint: You have to check your ego at the door, because you'll definitely starve otherwise.

You’re so hungry that you eat a table so you won’t starve. If you don’t eat this table, you will most definitely starve, so you eat the table to stay alive.

- Hint: You don’t want to starve, do you? Feel your tummy gurgle in pain. You gotta eat this table. Taste the dry wood taste on your tongue as you eat the table and get splinters in your tongue and gums.

You drive your scooter off this cliff, holding your cross tight to your chest, at a swift speed.

- Hint: Imagine swiftly shooting off the side of the cliff on your scooter, holding the cross for dear life.

There's power, power, and power stacked on top of the moon, threatening to bring it down!

- Hint: The moon actually looks like it wants to threaten you now too. It seems to have grown a big, smiling, angry mouth and it's way closer to you than you've ever seen it. All that power is radiating out of it and down towards you, threateningly.

Bite a tree's root with your fang to get an approximation on its age. It won't be exact, this isn't scientific or anything, but it will be pretty close.

- Hint: Once you have an approximation on the age, you'll be able to come up with an approximation on how much it's worth too.

You run your fingers along the words of a paragraph. You are learning about the law because you plan to arrest somebody.

- Hint: Imagine reading the paragraph very slowly. You find your answer. It looks like you'll be able to arrest that person...

If someone wants to boil, you let them boil!

- Hint: There's someone in your face yelling about how they want to boil! You yell back, "Okay, if you want to boil, just boil!"

If a helicopter loiters near a black hole then it's going to capsize. I mean, yeah, it's not a boat, but just look, that's what's happening! That helicopter is going down!

If you want to save it you better cover up the black hole! The only way to save it from capsizing is to cover it right up!

- Hint: Imagine trying to cover up a black hole so that the helicopter doesn't capsize. It's one or the other, dude. Cover or capsize. You decide.

The horse who can write a paragraph gets to be a chess piece. Only the most erudite of horses gets selected to be a chess piece. The knight’s chess piece is represented by a horse, and for a horse to earn this honor, they must first write a paragraph explaining why they deserve the honor.

- Hint: Imagine a horse trying to write a paragraph about why it deserves to be a chess piece. See the horse struggle with his hooves to write out a paragraph as he neighs in nervous frustration.

Your soul connects to five different mouths, enhancing your comprehension. You can easily comprehend what each of those souls belonging to those mouths wants and feels deep down.

- Hint: Imagine being able to comprehend everything about not one, but five other people. Deep down you can feel everything they think and feel.

Your soul is going wild because you're confused. If you're confused, it's usually because you don't know what's going on or what to do. This makes the soul inside your body go absolutely wild!

- Hint: Think back to the last time you were confused. Remember how your soul felt? You were so confused it went wild and made you feel dumb and bad, like a wild person.

Watch what you say to what appears to be a sweet tree, because that tree will 100% conspire against you.

- Hint: Trees may look all sweet and innocent, like they aren't listening to every word you say, but it's a front! They're conspiring against you!! They'll blackmail you and take everything!!!

On the roof there's some type of turkey bird, but thinner and longer. You look closer and realize it's a crane.

- Hint: Picture the beautiful black and white crane dancing gracefully on the roof. Now that you know what it is, you feel a little bad about calling it a turkey bird.

You use your fingers and a stone to begin cultivation of the land. You use your fingers to till the soil, the stone to flatten the ground, and you carefully poke the seeds into the dirt and then use the stone to smash them further down.

- Hint: Imagine being in a field, using your fingers and a stone to cultivate the whole thing, by hand.

You take a lid, and aiming it at the sun you kick it into the air and eventually it begins to decline and crashes into the sun, causing it to supernova. Imagine kicking this lid so hard that it flies into space. See it fly up to the peak of its arch, then watch as it begins the decline until it finally collides with the sun.

- Hint: As you watch the lid decline, keep in mind that the sun radical its middle line extending outside the box on both sides. This is because the sun is going supernova. Pew!

A commander who's big will use his size to encourage his troops.

- Hint: "Look at me! You can be a big commander someday too!" he shouts, encouraging everyone.

A tsunami and a couple fires run into each other. They cancel each other out completely, and the remainder left behind is a faint remnant of what was once there.

- Hint: You go to see if you can find any remainder of the fire + tsunami battle. You can, but it's so faint.

There’s a stone, a tree, another tree, and a coat rack. That stone and two trees will make the perfect foundation for a house to put that coat rack in! This stone is flat and heavy and both of the trees are flexible and durable.

- Hint: Imagine making a foundation with the stone and the two trees so you’ll have a place for your coat rack. Feel the wood grain and cold stone against your skin as you move them around to form the foundation.

Compare a building to some dirt and you'll see the difference between you and His and Her Highness. You live outside and sleep on the dirt. But His and Her Highness both live in a huge building.

- Hint: Picture Her Highness, high up in her building. Now compare her home and life to yours, you dirt person.

In the event of a tsunami, Wolverine, your forehead, and a stool will all be immersed in it. You will become immersed in the tsunami after it hits because tsunamis are gigantic and bring a lot of water. Now you and your forehead are immersed in the tsunami along with Wolverine and a stool.

- Hint: Feel the water all around you as you become immersed in this tsunami. See Wolverine trying to swim his way to the top as you watch the stool floating about in the water.

The few members of society without power suffer from severe inferiority complexes. Most people in this world have lots of power, so the few that do not feel quite inferior. It is this feeling of inferiority that fuels their inferiority complexes.

- Hint: Imagine you are one of the few without power. Feel the inferiority crushing down on you. It feels terrible and there is nothing you can do about it.

This crab trap has the power of intuition. By the power of intuition, this crab trap can trap like, every crab. Through intuition, it knows where the crabs will go and how they will react, so it is much easier to trap them.

- Hint: Look at this crab trap and see it visibly glowing with intuition. Its powers of intuition are so strong that you can actually see it shimmering with intuition as it expertly traps all those crabs.

A building that has a bully will isolate itself. Building have feelings like people, you know.

- Hint: Picture a single building, isolated from the rest of the city and those mean, bully buildings that live there.

In the foot capital, it's tough to be a dog because you're always getting kicked.

- Hint: In the foot capital, you can only use your feet. So petting dogs looks a lot like kicking them.

You take a stool, another stool, and yet another stool and stack them on top of a tree to make a mulberry bush. This is how mulberry bushes are made. You take three stools and you put them atop a tree.

- Hint: Imagine putting three stools on top of a tree and watching it transform into a mulberry. The science of nature!

You give a flag and a spoon to a nun as an offering. You give her this flag and this spoon because they are very precious to you and you want to show the nun how serious you are about repenting for your evil deeds.

- Hint: Imagine handing the nun your country’s flag. And also a spoon that is very valuable to you. Imagine getting down on one knee as you do so.

The king takes his slide into his private jet and is given a pearl as a gift, by you! He's letting you ride in his jet today, and you were told the king should be presented with a pearl as soon as he boards.

- Hint: Imagine giving this gorgeous white pearl to the king after he slides down his slide and boards the jet. See his king face light up as he sees the pretty pearl.

Your fingers give you a good reason to pluck things. You pluck flowers out of the ground. You pluck a cat out of a tree. Why? Because you have fingers! That's your reason.

- Hint: Imagine using your fingers to pluck grapes and apples and other things, maybe non-fruit things.

On the dirt there is a lid trying to cover the number of times the dawn has risen here. You walk over and pull the lid off and the whole thing transforms into a podium. A podium for the dawn to tell you how many times it's risen over this dirt over and over again. It just keeps going and you realize the lid was here because this dang podium can't seem to keep a lid on it! (Get it? Figure of speech!)

- Hint: This kanji also just... really looks like a podium right? With a guy wearing a graduation cap, pointing toward you, in the crowd.

The only type of can you'll be building in prison is one made of pottery. Do you honestly think they would let you have anything made of metal or plastic? No, too dangerous. You have to make all of your cans and plates and underpants the old-fashioned pottery way.

- Hint: Picture the first piece of pottery you ever made. Feel it in your hands. At least you've learned something new while you've been stuck in prison.

A woman sees herself (oneself) as a princess or a queen. As women should!

- Hint: Just remember, when you're around other women (and woman-aligned peoples), it's important to treat each other like princess and queens, not just oneself.

Take your greatest treasure, hold a knife nice and close to it, and prune away all the weak and dead bits.

- Hint: All treasures need to be taken care of, no matter what they are. Prune away anything that isn't necessary.

You stop a spoon from moving by tying it with thread that's purple. The spoon wouldn't stop moving around, so you had to use your favorite purple thread to make it stop. It's the strongest thread you have.

- Hint: Imagine tying this spoon down with thread that's a color other than purple. Ah, the thread snaps. Darn, you better use your extra strong purple thread (the best color for strength!).

The mouth of that turkey is solely his. It’s very unique, so that mouth could belong to no other turkey but him. That mouth is solely his.

- Hint: Imagine what makes this turkey’s mouth so unique. This beak is solely his. It belongs to no other. This turkey is the only turkey with a mouth like his.

A hill knife is the most sturdy knife you can find.

- Hint: The reason hill knives are so sturdy is because they are shaped like hills. Very wide, very thick, not so long. So, they don't break and are more sturdy.

If someone loiters it's correct to subjugate them.

- Hint: You can't just let people do whatever they want. If it isn't correct to loiter here, then it IS correct to subjugate them, and force them to do what you want. You control them now. And they're gonna get it!

With your fingers under an axe, you say a vow. A vow is a sacred promise, so you have to be really serious when you say one. That's why you do it with an axe hovering above your fingers—it's a reminder that if you break this vow your fingers are gonna get chopped off.

- Hint: Picture the axe hovering above your fingers. Now say the vow. But don't lie. The axe knows when you're lying.

The leader of this valley is very vulgar. The name of the valley is Vulgar Valley, so it makes sense for its leader to be very vulgar.

- Hint: Imagine meeting the leader of Vulgar Valley. Imagine all the vulgar things he says to prove he is worthy of being the leader of Vulgar Valley. He is so very, very vulgar.

A tsunami at the gate of the king makes sure all of his plants get watered. The gate prevents the tsunami from damaging anything inside the king’s home, and the plants around the gate get watered by the water of the tsunami.

- Hint: Hear the tsunami crash into the gate as you see the water slosh around and make sure that all of the king’s plants get good and watered.

The leader, Master Splinter (the rat from Ninja Turtles) isn't even supposed to exist. He exists because someone accidentally poured ooze on him.

- Hint: Imagine someone accidentally spilling ooze on a rat, then watch the rat turn into a sentient rat martial artist.

The construction beggar is one who begs for construction projects. He doesn't do it for money or fame, he begs for construction because he is so adept at what he does.

- Hint: The construction beggar looks like any other beggar, which makes it even stranger that he's so adept at what he does. He really puts everything into his construction work.

A fish in its mouth and in the other mouth is half a beggar (the head is cut off). The other half is on the ground. The animal that has fishes and beggars in its mouth, is an alligator.

- Hint: Just imagine the blood and fishes and beggars everywhere. The alligator is having a good meal tonight.

Put your fingers on the bed, grasp the sheets and bundle them up. Now you can do the laundry!

- Hint: Imagine pressing your fingers into the bed, grasping tightly and ripping the sheets free. Then you bundle them up into your arms so you can stuff them into the washing machine.

A horse that is fat is a burdensome animal.

- Hint: A fat horse. So burdensome. Not to mention the burden on the horse on top of the fatness.

A tsunami is the same as a cave. Because, if a wave is big enough, it will curl over on itself, creating a sort of cave within the wave. That's why it's the same as a cave!

- Hint: Also, imagine a tsunami hitting a cave, becoming the same as the cave (since a cave will shape it).

The leader all in white is the chief. All the other leaders are wearing some other color, but that's how you tell the chief apart from the other leaders.

- Hint: Imagine all the leaders standing around, then the chief person standing there all in white.

Under a canopy, someone thinking with a brush in their mouth has a sudden thought, and uses the brush to write the word "China". Thus, China was born.

- Hint: All of a sudden China existed! Pretty crazy, right?

You want to write a chapter about hair in your new book so you have to make sure it's really clear. Clear enough so that ANYbody can read it.

- Hint: Your writing is so clear and concise that just about everyone does read it. Well, everyone with hair that is.

Watch what you say to the next mouth over, because they hired you to consult them.

- Hint: The person with the next mouth in the room is waiting for you to open yours to consult them. He'll do whatever you say.

The Yoga King presides over all courts: law, imperial, and so forth. In this case, you've met him in the court of law, where he is judge, jury, and executioner.

- Hint: Picture him sitting above you in the judge's chair in court. He's about to make his judgement.

This is an animal with an angled sword claw that's filled with cow meat but looks like an insect. What kind of animal is that? It's a crab.

- Hint: If you think about the different parts you can see why this is a crab. A delicious, delicious crab.

The sun hits this and breaks into three suns. What can split the sun in three directions? A crystal!

- Hint: Crystals take light and refract it around into many directions. That's why there are three suns in this kanji.

A woman is making a dirt cage in the sun. She's using it to trap water, making this a dirt dam. If you think about it, dams are just dirt cages anyway.

- Hint: Picture the woman working tirelessly in the hot sun, moving and shaping the dirt around this river into a dam to make a pond.

If a tsunami hits your helicopter while you are jackhammering, it will drift out to sea. What were you doing with a jackhammer at a time like this? Now your helicopter is drifting away!

- Hint: Picture your helicopter as it drifts out to sea with the tsunami.

A tsunami hits a roof and then corrects itself. This causes it to swirl around, creating an eddy.

- Hint: An eddy requires water to change direction and then twirl around, and when the tsunami hits the roof, that's exactly what it does.

The correct way to block the sun with dirt is with an embankment. Build a huge, sloping embankment correctly and the sun won't be able to bother you ever again!

- Hint: Imagine an embankment made of dirt, in the correct place, blocking the sun from your eyes.

You walk out on a cliff, where you find in the ground a mouth poking out. It speaks: "It is me, the empress of these lands!"

- Hint: She was buried in the cliff down to her mouth so nobody would find her! You pull her out of the ground and soon what was just a mouth becomes a whole empress!

Turn a sickness into a weapon and it becomes an epidemic. This sickness spreads to everyone and it's all your fault because you put it in the water supply.

- Hint: Imagine if countries decided to make sick weapons that would spread epidemics like this all over part of the world. Let's hope they don't...

You have a numbered feather. Pick your favorite number and put it on the feather. Then, put the numbered feather on your head. When you put it on, you're able to flip and flip over and over.

- Hint: Imagine yourself doing flips with this feather on your head. Flip flip flip.

A tree can be a tree, but it can also be a psychopath. The tree goes from being a regular tree to being a psychopath. Such mood swings are so rough. Especially when the tree slips to gloom.

- Hint: Imagine all the mood swings of this tree. Psychopath tree! Also very gloomy sometimes.

There is a tsunami coming up over a cliff made of dirt. You can see this happening very far away because it's right on the horizon.

- Hint: Picture the tsunami breaking over the cliff on the horizon. It would be beautiful if it wasn't so frightening.

A gold name on this piece of wood is the inscription that shows the artist's signature.

- Hint: This inscription refers to a signature or something similar. This is an artisan's signature in the form of an inscription.

The leader cat pirate is the greatest cat pirate of them all. It leads all the cat pirate leaders, even! This is truly a cat pirate to look up to.

- Hint: Imagine this majestic cat pirate leader of leaders. Feel in your heart that you look up to this cat pirate, truly.

A tsunami crashes into the sun, which is then caught in a net tied to a stool! Wait a second... this doesn't sound realistic, this is from that pirate manga you're always reading!

- Hint: Imagine reading this issue of your favorite stretchy pirate boy manga, Lumpy uses his arms as a net, his legs tied to a stool, and traps the sun in a net right as the tsunami hits. Gee what kind of crazy trouble is he getting into this time?!

A bamboo tsunami's specialty is to crush everything in front of it, smash down, and turn into multiple record books.

- Hint: The bamboo flattens as it hits the ground then turns into papers. The papers combine to become record books that show what happened here, this day.

The restaurant radical and the restaurant kanji are the same!

- Hint: Know your radicals, yo!

What you say on the street needs to be revised. Your words need to be polished, you can't publish improv. Revise your street word inspiration before you share it again.

- Hint: Think about all the stupid things you said on the streets today. Do you want those exact phrases, mistakes, and mouth sounds following you around forever? Revise it before you write it down!

A samurai who can fight with icicles on him is more robust than regular samurai. Can you imagine how robust you'd have to be to fight in weather cold enough to form icicles on your body?

- Hint: Picture samurai standing in a line. One, two, three... woah. You look up. This guy has icicles growing off him and he's the size of a bus. Now that's a robust samurai.

There are nine cars all driving in the same place. With so many cars driving in the same place, they create a rut.

- Hint: Imagine the cars spinning out in the rut. Spin spin spin. The rut gets bigger. Nine is too many cars.

A big turkey in the rice paddy is getting all stirred up. He's kicking up all the rice. Who stirred him up?

- Hint: He is a really big turkey too. Like, 12 feet tall, or something. Don't want to stir up a turkey that's that big.

At the top of the mountain is a signpost to tell you you've reached the summit. Literally every mountain that humans have reached the top of has one of these summit signs.

- Hint: If that signpost wasn't there how would you know you reached the summit? Like, if you were on top of Everest and there was a bad storm... you'd just topple off the other side. Those summit signposts are important!

There's a cross in the dirt and the dirt is surrounded by flowers and shells from shellfish. This is a tomb. The flowers and shellfish were put here as decorations and to honor the dead that currently lay under the dirt. And the cross marks the tomb, obviously.

- Hint: Can you picture this big dirt tomb, with flowers and shellfish decorating it and a cross right on top?

With your fingers you put some weapons in a boat for transport. This is a transport boat and its your job to get these weapons from one place to another.

- Hint: Imagine loading a bunch of weapons into a boat and sailing off to transport them somewhere else.

A fang on a building shows that it's wicked. Something wicked probably lives in the building too.

- Hint: Not like, wicked cool, but like wicked evil. I see you, New Englanders.

We must stop the moon. That, at least, we can come to an agreement on.

- Hint: There are a group of people pointing at pictures of the moon coming closer to earth. They are the world's leaders, and although they don't get along normally, this new attack from the moon has united them in agreement: we must stop the moon.

If you want to have a tsunami at your wedding, you need to make sure you have it at the bay. Anywhere more inland, and the tsunami won't reach it in time.

- Hint: Picture the tsunami coming towards your beautiful wedding as you stand by the bay. It's not safe, but it's memorable!

Your fingers have husband horns. They are there right between each of your fingers.

- Hint: Imagine little husband horns (the horns your husband has) between all your fingers. Emphasis on _between_.

If a tsunami hits a dollar the water will instantly start to boil!

- Hint: Imagine standing in front of an incoming tsunami. Suddenly in the distance you see someone throwing dollar bills into it and it starts to boil. Ahh!

A lantern with horns that can hold ten thousand drops of water is sitting on the ground. You get closer and realize it's not a lantern, it's a bottle. It's got horns, and a weird handle, but it's definitely a bottle with water inside of it.

- Hint: Picture this horned bottle sitting on the ground. You don't know who left it here or why, but it's here and the weirdest looking bottle you've ever seen.
